original: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams chags pa dang / ma chags pa ma mchis par shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di legs par bshad pa dang / legs par mthar phyung ba'i bar ni ngo mtshar che'o zhes bya ba ni thabs kyis mi ring ba yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams chags pa dang / ma chags pa ma mchis par shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di legs par bshad pa dang / legs par mthar phyung ba'i bar ni ngo mtshar che'o zhes bya ba ni thabs kyis mi ring ba yin no //
translated: “Blessed One, it is amazing that you have explained this perfection of wisdom to bodhisattva great beings without attachment and without non-attachment, and brought it to completion.” This is the nearness due to skillful means.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Then the venerable Śāriputra said to the venerable Subhūti,

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe chags pa dang bcas pa ni gang yin /🔽ma chags pa ni gang yin /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe chags pa dang bcas pa ni gang yin / ma chags pa ni gang yin /
translated: “Venerable Subhūti, when bodhisattva great beings are practicing the perfection of wisdom, what is being attached and what is not being attached?”

original: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /🔽tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu 'di la byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa'i rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu 'di la byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa'i rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: Subhūti replied,

original: rigs kyi bu mo thabs mi mkhas pas gzugs stong zhes bya bar 'du shes na chags pa'o //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo thabs mi mkhas pas gzugs stong zhes bya bar 'du shes na chags pa'o //
translated: “Venerable Śāriputra, here sons of a good family or daughters of a good family in the Bodhisattva Vehicle, unskilled in means, if they perceive form as empty, that is attachment.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa stong zhes bya bar 'du shes na chags pa'o //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa stong zhes bya bar 'du shes na chags pa'o //
translated: If they perceive feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness as empty, that is attachment.

original: de bzhin du so so ba dang / bsdus pa'i phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung bar stong zhes bya bar 'du shes na chags pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du so so ba dang / bsdus pa'i phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung bar stong zhes bya bar 'du shes na chags pa'o //
translated: Likewise, if one perceives the aggregates, whether individually or collectively, the elements, the sense fields, and dependent origination as empty, one is attached.

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa stong zhes bya bar 'du shes na chags pa'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa stong zhes bya bar 'du shes na chags pa'o //
translated: If one perceives the perfection of generosity as empty, one is attached.

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong zhes bya bar 'du shes na chags pa'o //🔽bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa stong zhes bya bar 'du shes na chags pa'o //🔽brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong zhes bya bar 'du shes na chags @150b pa'o ;
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong zhes bya bar 'du shes na chags pa'o // bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa stong zhes bya bar 'du shes na chags pa'o // brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong zhes bya bar 'du shes na chags @150b pa'o ;
translated: If one perceives the perfection of morality as empty, one is attached.🔽If one perceives the perfection of patience as empty, one is attached.🔽If one perceives the perfection of effort as empty, one is attached.

original: / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong zhes bya bar 'du shes na chags pa'o //
analyzed: / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong zhes bya bar 'du shes na chags pa'o //
translated: If one perceives the perfection of concentration as empty, one is attached.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong zhes bya bar 'du shes na chags pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong zhes bya bar 'du shes na chags pa'o //
translated: If one perceives the perfection of wisdom as empty, one is attached.

original: de bzhin du dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams stong zhes bya bar 'du shes na chags pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams stong zhes bya bar 'du shes na chags pa'o //
translated: Likewise, if one perceives the applications of mindfulness as empty, one is attached.

original: yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / lam rnams stong zhes bya bar 'du shes na chags pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / lam rnams stong zhes bya bar 'du shes na chags pa'o //
translated: If one perceives the right efforts, legs of miraculous power, faculties, powers, limbs of awakening, and path as empty, one is attached.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams stong zhes bya bar 'du shes na chags pa'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams stong zhes bya bar 'du shes na chags pa'o //
translated: If one perceives the noble truths as empty, one is attached.

original: tshad med pa dang / bsam gtan dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams stong zhes bya bar 'du shes na chags pa'o //
analyzed: tshad med pa dang / bsam gtan dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams stong zhes bya bar 'du shes na chags pa'o //
translated: If one perceives the immeasurables, concentrations, and formless absorptions as empty, one is attached.

original: rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa stong zhes bya bar 'du shes na chags pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa stong zhes bya bar 'du shes na chags pa'o //
translated: If one perceives the eight liberations, nine serial absorptions, emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness as empty, one is attached.

original: de bzhin du mngon par shes pa rnams dang / ting nge 'dzin thams cad dang / gzungs kyi sgo thams cad stong zhes bya bar 'du shes na chags pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du mngon par shes pa rnams dang / ting nge 'dzin thams cad dang / gzungs kyi sgo thams cad stong zhes bya bar 'du shes na chags pa'o //
translated: Similarly, if they perceive the superknowledges, all the meditative stabilizations, and all the dhāraṇī gateways as empty, they are attached.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi stong zhes bya bar 'du shes na chags pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi stong zhes bya bar 'du shes na chags pa'o //
translated: If they perceive the ten powers of the tathāgatas, the four fearlessnesses, and the four detailed and thorough knowledges as empty, they are attached.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad stong zhes bya bar 'du shes na chags pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad stong zhes bya bar 'du shes na chags pa'o //
translated: If they perceive the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha as empty, they are attached.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du stong zhes bya bar 'du shes na chags pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du stong zhes bya bar 'du shes na chags pa'o //
translated: If they perceive up to the knowledge of all aspects as empty, they are attached.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po thabs mi mkhas pas 'das pa'i chos rnams la 'das pa'i chos zhes bya bar 'du shes na chags pa'o //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po thabs mi mkhas pas 'das pa'i chos rnams la 'das pa'i chos zhes bya bar 'du shes na chags pa'o //
translated: “Moreover, Venerable Śāriputra, if bodhisattva great beings unskilled in means perceive past dharmas as past dharmas, they are attached.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i chos rnams la ma 'ongs pa'i chos zhes bya bar 'du shes na chags pa'o //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i chos rnams la ma 'ongs pa'i chos zhes bya bar 'du shes na chags pa'o //
translated: If he perceives future dharmas as future dharmas, he is attached.

original: da ltar byung ba'i chos rnams la da ltar byung ba'i chos zhes bya bar 'du shes na chags pa'o //
analyzed: da ltar byung ba'i chos rnams la da ltar byung ba'i chos zhes bya bar 'du shes na chags pa'o //
translated: If he perceives present dharmas as present dharmas, he is attached.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dmigs pa'i tshul gyis sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung nas sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod na chags pa'o //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dmigs pa'i tshul gyis sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung nas sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod na chags pa'o //
translated: Moreover, Venerable Śāriputra, if bodhisattva great beings, from the production of the thought of enlightenment up to sitting on the terrace of enlightenment, practice the perfection of giving while taking things as a basis, they are attached.

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa @151a * //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa @151a * //
translated: If they practice the perfection of morality, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance,

original: dang ; bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod na chags pa'o //
analyzed: dang ; bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod na chags pa'o //
translated: the perfection of concentration, and the perfection of wisdom while taking things as a basis, they are attached.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams la spyod na chags pa'o //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams la spyod na chags pa'o //
translated: If they practice the applications of mindfulness while taking things as a basis, they are attached.

original: yang dag par spong pa dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang ba dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / lam la spyod na chags pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag par spong pa dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang ba dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / lam la spyod na chags pa'o //
translated: If one practices the right efforts, the legs of supernatural power, the faculties, the powers, the limbs of enlightenment, and the path, one is attached.

original: de bzhin du tshad med pa dang / bsam gtan dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams la spyod na chags pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du tshad med pa dang / bsam gtan dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams la spyod na chags pa'o //
translated: If one practices the immeasurables, the concentrations, and the formless absorptions, one is attached.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / mngon par shes pa rnams dang / ting nge 'dzin thams cad dang /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / mngon par shes pa rnams dang / ting nge 'dzin thams cad dang /
translated: If one practices the noble truths, emptiness, signlessness, wishlessness, the eight liberations, the nine serial absorptions, the clairvoyances, all the meditative stabilizations,

original: gzungs kyi sgo thams cad la spyod na chags pa'o //
analyzed: gzungs kyi sgo thams cad la spyod na chags pa'o //
translated: and all the dhāraṇī gateways, one is attached.

original: stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la spyod na chags pa'o //
analyzed: stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la spyod na chags pa'o //
translated: If one practices the powers, the fearlessnesses, the detailed and thorough knowledges, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha, one is attached.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la spyod na chags pa'o zhes bya ba ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin no //🔽tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu gang yang 'di skad du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la spyod na chags pa'o zhes bya ba ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin no // tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu gang yang 'di skad du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: Up to and including the knowledge of all aspects, if one engages in them, it is attachment.🔽This is the counteragent.🔽Venerable Śāriputra, you asked, “What is non-attachment for bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom?”

original: ma chags pa ni gang yin zhes zer ba ni tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po thabs mkhas pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: ma chags pa ni gang yin zhes zer ba ni tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po thabs mkhas pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra, here, when bodhisattva great beings skilled in means practice the perfection of wisdom, they think like this:

original: 'di snyam du gzugs la gzugs zhes bya bar 'du shes pa med do //
analyzed: 'di snyam du gzugs la gzugs zhes bya bar 'du shes pa med do //
translated: “There is no perception of form as ‘form.’

original: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa la rnam par shes pa zhes bya bar 'du shes pa med do //
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa la rnam par shes pa zhes bya bar 'du shes pa med do //
translated: Similarly, there is no perception of feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness as ‘consciousness.’

original: 'das pa'i chos rnams la 'das pa'i chos zhes bya bar 'du shes pa med do //🔽ma 'ongs pa'i chos rnams la ma 'ongs pa'i chos zhes bya bar 'du shes pa med do //
analyzed: 'das pa'i chos rnams la 'das pa'i chos zhes bya bar 'du shes pa med do // ma 'ongs pa'i chos rnams la ma 'ongs pa'i chos zhes bya bar 'du shes pa med do //
translated: They do not have the idea that past phenomena are past phenomena.🔽They do not have the idea that future phenomena are future phenomena.

original: da ltar byung ba'i chos rnams la da ltar byung ba'i chos zhes bya bar 'du shes pa med do //
analyzed: da ltar byung ba'i chos rnams la da ltar byung ba'i chos zhes bya bar 'du shes pa med do //
translated: They do not have the idea that present phenomena are present phenomena.

original: sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po thabs mkhas pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /🔽'di snyam du bdag gis sbyin pa zhig sbyin no //
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po thabs mkhas pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe / 'di snyam du bdag gis sbyin pa zhig sbyin no //
translated: Śāriputra, bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom with skillful means🔽think, ‘I will give a gift.

original: 'di la sbyin pa zhig sbyin no //
analyzed: 'di la sbyin pa zhig sbyin no //
translated: I will give a gift to this one.

original: sbyin pa ni 'di lta bu zhig sbyin no @151b zhe'am /
analyzed: sbyin pa ni 'di lta bu zhig sbyin no @151b zhe'am /
translated: I will give this kind of gift.’

original: bdag gis tshul khrims bsrung ngo //
analyzed: bdag gis tshul khrims bsrung ngo //
translated: ‘I will guard morality.

original: tshul khrims ni 'di lta bu zhig bsrung ngo //
analyzed: tshul khrims ni 'di lta bu zhig bsrung ngo //
translated: I will guard this kind of morality.

original: 'di rnams la tshul khrims bsrung ngo zhe'am /🔽bdag gis bzod pa zhig bsgom mo //
analyzed: 'di rnams la tshul khrims bsrung ngo zhe'am / bdag gis bzod pa zhig bsgom mo //
translated: I will guard morality for these ones.’🔽‘I will cultivate patience.

original: bzod pa ni 'di lta bu zhig bsgom mo //
analyzed: bzod pa ni 'di lta bu zhig bsgom mo //
translated: I will cultivate this kind of patience.’

original: 'di rnams la bzod pa bsgom mo zhe'am //🔽bdag gis brtson 'grus shig brtsam mo //
analyzed: 'di rnams la bzod pa bsgom mo zhe'am // bdag gis brtson 'grus shig brtsam mo //
translated: I will cultivate patience toward them.🔽I will make an effort.

original: brtson 'grus ni 'di lta bu zhig brtsam mo //
analyzed: brtson 'grus ni 'di lta bu zhig brtsam mo //
translated: I will make this kind of effort.

original: 'di rnams kyi don du brtson 'grus brtsam mo zhe'am /
analyzed: 'di rnams kyi don du brtson 'grus brtsam mo zhe'am /
translated: I will make an effort for their sake.

original: bdag gis bsam gtan zhig la mnyam par gzhag go //🔽bsam gtan ni 'di lta bu zhig la mnyam par gzhag go //
analyzed: bdag gis bsam gtan zhig la mnyam par gzhag go // bsam gtan ni 'di lta bu zhig la mnyam par gzhag go //
translated: I will rest in meditation.🔽I will rest in this kind of meditation.

original: 'di ltar bsam gtan la mnyam par gzhag go zhe'am /
analyzed: 'di ltar bsam gtan la mnyam par gzhag go zhe'am /
translated: I will rest in meditation like this.

original: bdag gis shes rab cig bsgom mo //🔽shes rab ni 'di lta bu zhig bsgom mo //
analyzed: bdag gis shes rab cig bsgom mo // shes rab ni 'di lta bu zhig bsgom mo //
translated: I will cultivate wisdom.🔽I will cultivate this kind of wisdom.

original: 'di rnams la shes rab bsgom mo zhe'am /
analyzed: 'di rnams la shes rab bsgom mo zhe'am /
translated: I will cultivate wisdom for their sake.

original: bdag gis bsod nams shig bskyed do //🔽bsod nams 'di lta bu zhig bskyed do //
analyzed: bdag gis bsod nams shig bskyed do // bsod nams 'di lta bu zhig bskyed do //
translated: I will create merit.🔽I will create this kind of merit.

original: bsod nams 'di tsam zhig bskyed do zhe'am /
analyzed: bsod nams 'di tsam zhig bskyed do zhe'am /
translated: I will create this much merit.

original: bdag gis ni byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med par chud par bya'o zhe'am /
analyzed: bdag gis ni byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med par chud par bya'o zhe'am /
translated: I will enter into the faultlessness of the bodhisattvas.

original: bdag gis ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bya'o zhe'am /
analyzed: bdag gis ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bya'o zhe'am /
translated: I will purify a buddhafield.

original: bdag gis ni sems can yongs su smin par bya'o zhe'am /
analyzed: bdag gis ni sems can yongs su smin par bya'o zhe'am /
translated: “I will bring beings to full maturity,” or

original: bdag gis ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par bya'o snyam du sems pa med do //
analyzed: bdag gis ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par bya'o snyam du sems pa med do //
translated: “I will attain the knowledge of all aspects.”

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams thabs mkhas pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams thabs mkhas pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom through skillful means,

original: rnam par rtog pa de lta bu thams cad mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa de lta bu thams cad mi 'byung ngo //
translated: all such conceptual thoughts do not occur.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: nang stong pa nyid dang / phyi stong pa nyid dang / phyi nang stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar gyi phyir ro //
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid dang / phyi stong pa nyid dang / phyi nang stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar gyi phyir ro //
translated: It is because of inner emptiness, outer emptiness, inner and outer emptiness, up to the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i thabs mkhas pas ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i thabs mkhas pas ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra, those are the skillful means of bodhisattva great beings when they practice the perfection of wisdom.

original: ma chags pa'o zhes bya ba ni gnyen po'i phyogs yin no //
analyzed: ma chags pa'o zhes bya ba ni gnyen po'i phyogs yin no //
translated: “Non-attachment” is the antidote.

original: de nas lha rnams kyi dbang po brgya byin gyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de nas lha rnams kyi dbang po brgya byin gyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Then Śakra, Lord of the Gods, said to the venerable Su­bhūti,

original: btsun pa rab 'byor rnam grangs gang gis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi chags par 'gyur ba yin /
analyzed: btsun pa rab 'byor rnam grangs gang gis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi chags par 'gyur ba yin /
translated: “Venerable Su­bhūti, by what method do the bodhisattva great beings become attached?

original: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
translated: ” Su­bhūti replied,

original: koo shi ka 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems su 'du shes pa dang / sbyin par 'du shes @152a * //
analyzed: koo shi ka 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems su 'du shes pa dang / sbyin par 'du shes @152a * //
translated: “Kauśika, here, the bodhisattvas have the notion of a sentient being, the notion of generosity,

original: pa dang / de bzhin du tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab tu 'du shes pa dang / nang stong pa nyid du 'du shes pa dang / phyi stong pa nyid du 'du shes pa dang /
analyzed: pa dang / de bzhin du tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab tu 'du shes pa dang / nang stong pa nyid du 'du shes pa dang / phyi stong pa nyid du 'du shes pa dang /
translated: the notion of moral discipline, the notion of patient acceptance, the notion of perseverance, the notion of meditative concentration, the notion of wisdom, the notion of inner emptiness, the notion of outer emptiness,

original: phyi nang stong pa nyid du 'du shes pa dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar du 'du shes pa dang / de bzhin du byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa dang /
analyzed: phyi nang stong pa nyid du 'du shes pa dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar du 'du shes pa dang / de bzhin du byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa dang /
translated: the perception of the emptiness of external and internal phenomena, up to the perception of the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature, and similarly, the thirty-seven aspects of enlightenment, the noble truths,

original: tshad med pa dang / bsam gtan dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang /
analyzed: tshad med pa dang / bsam gtan dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang /
translated: the immeasurables, the dhyānas, the formless absorptions, the dhāraṇī gateways, the ten powers of the tathāgatas, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad du 'du shes pa dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das su 'du shes pa dang / sangs rgyas la bskyed pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba dag tu 'du shes nas dge ba de dag mngon par bsdus te gcig tu bsdoms shing gzhal nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su sngo bar byed pa 'di ni /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad du 'du shes pa dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das su 'du shes pa dang / sangs rgyas la bskyed pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba dag tu 'du shes nas dge ba de dag mngon par bsdus te gcig tu bsdoms shing gzhal nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su sngo bar byed pa 'di ni /
translated: and the eighteen distinctive qualities of the Buddha, and the perception of the Blessed Buddhas, and the perception of the wholesome roots produced in regard to the Buddhas, and having collected those wholesome roots, having added them together, having measured them, he dedicates them to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: koo shi ka byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi chags pa ste /
analyzed: koo shi ka byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi chags pa ste /
translated: Kauśika, this is the attachment of bodhisattva great beings,

original: gang gis chags pa med pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod par mi nus so //
analyzed: gang gis chags pa med pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod par mi nus so //
translated: by which they are unable to practice the perfection of wisdom without attachment.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why is that?

original: koo shi ka gzugs kyi rang bzhin yongs su bsngo bar mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: koo shi ka gzugs kyi rang bzhin yongs su bsngo bar mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Kauśika, it is because the intrinsic nature of form cannot be dedicated.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin yongs su sngo bar mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin yongs su sngo bar mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is impossible to dedicate the nature of feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness.

original: de bzhin du so so ba dang / bsdus pa'i phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i rang bzhin yongs su bsngo bar mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du so so ba dang / bsdus pa'i phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i rang bzhin yongs su bsngo bar mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Similarly, it is impossible to dedicate the nature of the individual and combined aggregates, elements, sense fields, and dependent origination.

original: de bzhin du pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams dang / tshad med pa rnams dang / bsam gtan rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams dang / tshad med pa rnams dang / bsam gtan rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang /
translated: Similarly, it is impossible to dedicate the perfections, thirty-seven factors of awakening, four noble truths, immeasurables, concentrations, formless absorptions,

original: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / mngon par shes pa rnams dang / ting nge 'dzin @152b rnams dang /
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / mngon par shes pa rnams dang / ting nge 'dzin @152b rnams dang /
translated: emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness, the eight liberations, the nine serial steps of meditative absorption, the six kinds of preternatural knowledge, the meditative stabilities,🔽

original: gzungs kyi sgo rnams dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams kyi rang bzhin yongs su bsngo bar mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzungs kyi sgo rnams dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams kyi rang bzhin yongs su bsngo bar mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: the emptiness, the signless, the wishless, the eight deliverances, the nine serial absorptions, the ten powers of the tathāgatas, the fearlessnesses, the detailed and thorough knowledges, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: koo shi ka rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rang bzhin yongs su bsngo bar mi nus pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin no //
analyzed: koo shi ka rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rang bzhin yongs su bsngo bar mi nus pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin no //
translated: “Kauśika, it is because you cannot dedicate the nature of the knowledge of all aspects.”🔽This is the counteragent.

original: koo shi ka gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos gzhan bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yang dag par bstan par 'dod pa dang ; len du gzhug par 'dod pa dang / gzengs bstod par 'dod pa dang /
analyzed: koo shi ka gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos gzhan bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yang dag par bstan par 'dod pa dang ; len du gzhug par 'dod pa dang / gzengs bstod par 'dod pa dang /
translated: “Furthermore, Kauśika, bodhisattva great beings who want to teach others, who want to take them up, who want to encourage them,

original: yang dag par rab tu dga' bar bya bar 'dod pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rjes su song ba'i yid kyis gzhan la yang dag par bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: yang dag par rab tu dga' bar bya bar 'dod pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rjes su song ba'i yid kyis gzhan la yang dag par bstan par bya'o //
translated: and who want to delight them in unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening should teach others with a mind that has gone to the real.

original: len du gzhug par bya'o //🔽gzengs bstod par bya'o //
analyzed: len du gzhug par bya'o // gzengs bstod par bya'o //
translated: They should take them up.🔽They should encourage them.

original: yang dag par rab tu dga' bar bya'o //
analyzed: yang dag par rab tu dga' bar bya'o //
translated: They should delight them.

original: ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: How do bodhisattva great beings, when practicing the perfection of wisdom,

original: bdag ni sbyin pa gtong ba'o //
analyzed: bdag ni sbyin pa gtong ba'o //
translated: give gifts?

original: bdag ni tshul khrims bsrung ba'o //🔽bdag ni bzod pa bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: bdag ni tshul khrims bsrung ba'o // bdag ni bzod pa bsgom pa'o //
translated: How do they guard morality?🔽How do they cultivate patience?

original: bdag ni brtson 'grus brtsam pa'o //
analyzed: bdag ni brtson 'grus brtsam pa'o //
translated: How do they make an effort at perseverance?

original: bdag ni bsam gtan la snyoms par 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: bdag ni bsam gtan la snyoms par 'jug pa'o //
translated: I am absorbed in concentration.

original: bdag ni shes rab bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: bdag ni shes rab bsgom pa'o //
translated: I am cultivating wisdom.

original: bdag ni nang stong pa nyid la spyod do //🔽bdag ni phyi stong pa nyid la spyod do //
analyzed: bdag ni nang stong pa nyid la spyod do // bdag ni phyi stong pa nyid la spyod do //
translated: I am practicing inner emptiness.🔽I am practicing outer emptiness.

original: bdag ni phyi nang stong pa nyid la spyod do //
analyzed: bdag ni phyi nang stong pa nyid la spyod do //
translated: I am practicing inner and outer emptiness.

original: bdag ni dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar la spyod do //
analyzed: bdag ni dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar la spyod do //
translated: I am practicing up to the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature.

original: bdag ni byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: bdag ni byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun bsgom pa'o //
translated: I am cultivating the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening.

original: bdag ni 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: bdag ni 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams bsgom pa'o //
translated: I am cultivating the four noble truths.

original: bdag ni tshad med pa dang / bsam gtan dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams la snyoms par 'jug go //
analyzed: bdag ni tshad med pa dang / bsam gtan dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams la snyoms par 'jug go //
translated: I am absorbed in the limitless, the concentrations, and the formless absorptions.

original: bdag ni stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: bdag ni stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa bsgom pa'o //
translated: I am cultivating emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness.

original: bdag ni rnam par thar pa brgyad bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: bdag ni rnam par thar pa brgyad bsgom pa'o //
translated: I am cultivating the eight deliverances.

original: bdag ni mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu la snyoms par 'jug go //
analyzed: bdag ni mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu la snyoms par 'jug go //
translated: I am entering into the nine successive abodes in meditative stabilization.

original: bdag ni mngon par shes pa rnams len no //
analyzed: bdag ni mngon par shes pa rnams len no //
translated: I am taking up the clairvoyances.

original: bdag ni ting nge 'dzin rnams la snyoms par 'jug go //
analyzed: bdag ni ting nge 'dzin rnams la snyoms par 'jug go //
translated: I am entering into the meditative stabilizations.

original: bdag ni gzungs kyi sgo rnams la snyoms par 'jug go //
analyzed: bdag ni gzungs kyi sgo rnams la snyoms par 'jug go //
translated: I am entering into the dhāraṇī gateways.

original: bdag ni @153a * //
analyzed: bdag ni @153a * //
translated: I am entering into the emptiness gateway.

original: stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams bsgom mo //
analyzed: stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams bsgom mo //
translated: I am cultivating the ten powers, the fearlessnesses, the detailed and thorough knowledges, and the distinct attributes of a buddha.🔽I am practicing for awakening.’

original: bdag ni byang chub la spyod do zhes bya bar rnam par rtog par mi 'gyur ba de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos gzhan la yang dag par bstan par bya /🔽len du gzhug par bya /🔽gzengs bstod par bya /
analyzed: bdag ni byang chub la spyod do zhes bya bar rnam par rtog par mi 'gyur ba de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos gzhan la yang dag par bstan par bya / len du gzhug par bya / gzengs bstod par bya /
translated: “Bodhisattva great beings should teach others like this,🔽should make them take it up,🔽should make them enthusiastic,

original: yang dag par rab tu dga' bar bya ste /
analyzed: yang dag par rab tu dga' bar bya ste /
translated: and should make them rejoice.

original: bdag nyid kyang rma 'byung bar mi 'gyur zhing gzhan yang sangs rgyas kyis gnang ba'i len du gzhug pas len du gzhug par bya /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyang rma 'byung bar mi 'gyur zhing gzhan yang sangs rgyas kyis gnang ba'i len du gzhug pas len du gzhug par bya /
translated: He himself will not be wounded, and he will also cause others to take up the practice of the Buddha.

original: yang dag par rab tu dga' bar bya'o //
analyzed: yang dag par rab tu dga' bar bya'o //
translated: He should cause them to take it up, and he should gladden them.

original: koo shi ka de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yang dag par bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: koo shi ka de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yang dag par bstan par bya'o //
translated: Kauśika, bodhisattva great beings should be shown, should be caused to take up,

original: len du gzhug par bya'o //🔽gzengs bstod par bya'o //
analyzed: len du gzhug par bya'o // gzengs bstod par bya'o //
translated: should be caused to take it up,🔽should be caused to be gladdened,

original: yang dag par rab tu dga' bar bya'o //
analyzed: yang dag par rab tu dga' bar bya'o //
translated: and should be gladdened in unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: de ltar na rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: de ltar na rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: In that way, that son of a good family or🔽daughter of a good family will completely abandon all the extremes of attachment.”

original: rigs kyi bu mo des chags pa'i mtha' thams cad yongs su spong bar 'gyur ba yin no zhes bya ba ni gnyen po'i phyogs yin no //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo des chags pa'i mtha' thams cad yongs su spong bar 'gyur ba yin no zhes bya ba ni gnyen po'i phyogs yin no //
translated: This is the antidote.🔽Then the Lord said to the venerable Subhūti,

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la bka' stsal pa /
translated: “Subhūti, you have spoken well,🔽you have spoken well.

original: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams la chags pa'i mtha' 'di dag mdor bstan pa legs so legs so //
analyzed: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams la chags pa'i mtha' 'di dag mdor bstan pa legs so legs so //
translated: “Subhūti, it is excellent, excellent that you have taught these extremes of attachment to the bodhisattva great beings in brief.

original: rab 'byor de bas na nga chags pa'i mtha' phra ba ngas rgyas par bstan par byas /
analyzed: rab 'byor de bas na nga chags pa'i mtha' phra ba ngas rgyas par bstan par byas /
translated: Subhūti, therefore I will teach the subtle extremes of attachment in detail.

original: de shin tu legs par nyon la yid la zung shig dang bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: de shin tu legs par nyon la yid la zung shig dang bstan par bya'o //
translated: Listen well and keep it in mind, I will teach it.

original: bcom ldan 'das de ltar bgyi'o zhes nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor bcom ldan 'das la phyir nyan to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de ltar bgyi'o zhes nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor bcom ldan 'das la phyir nyan to //
translated: “Blessed One, I will do so,” the venerable Subhūti replied to the Blessed One, and listened.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: The Blessed One said this:

original: rab 'byor 'di ltar rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di ltar rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: “Subhūti, it is like this:

original: rigs kyi bu mo gang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yang dag par zhugs pa de bzhin gshegs pa mtshan mar yid la byed na /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo gang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yang dag par zhugs pa de bzhin gshegs pa mtshan mar yid la byed na /
translated: If a son or daughter of good family who has set out for unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening mentally engages with the Tathāgata as a sign,

original: rab 'byor ji tsam du mtshan mar gyur pa de tsam du chags pa'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor ji tsam du mtshan mar gyur pa de tsam du chags pa'o //
translated: Subhūti, to the extent that there is a sign, to that extent there is attachment.

original: gang yang de bzhin gshegs pa de dag gis thugs dang po bskyed pa nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas kyi bar dang / phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i bar dang /🔽dam pa'i chos gnas kyi bar gyi dge ba'i rtsa ba gang ji snyed pa de dag thams cad mtshan mar yid la byed cing yid la byas nas bla na @153b med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo na /
analyzed: gang yang de bzhin gshegs pa de dag gis thugs dang po bskyed pa nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas kyi bar dang / phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i bar dang / dam pa'i chos gnas kyi bar gyi dge ba'i rtsa ba gang ji snyed pa de dag thams cad mtshan mar yid la byed cing yid la byas nas bla na @153b med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo na /
translated: and whatever wholesome roots there are of those tathāgatas from their first production of the thought of enlightenment up to their supreme complete enlightenment, up to their passing into complete nirvāṇa,🔽and up to the disappearance of the good dharma, if, having taken them as signs, they dedicate them to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening,

original: rab 'byor ji tsam du mtshan mar yid la byed pa de tsam du chags pa'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor ji tsam du mtshan mar yid la byed pa de tsam du chags pa'o //
translated: to that extent, Subhūti, there is attachment, to that extent there is a sign, to that extent there is a basis, to that extent there is conceptualization, to that extent there is mental fabrication, to that extent there is a view, to that extent there is a standpoint, to that extent there is a position, to that extent there is a grasping, to that extent there is a rejection, to that extent there is a denial, to that extent there is a view of the perishable composite, to that extent there is a view of the transitory collection, to that extent there is a view of the extremes, to that extent there is a view of the two extremes, to that extent there is a view of the two extremes, to that extent there is a view of the two extremes, to that extent there is a view of the two extremes, to that extent there is a view of the two extremes, to that extent there is a view of the two extremes, to that extent there is a view of the two extremes, to that extent there is a view of the two extremes, to that extent there is a view of the two extremes, to that extent there is a view of the two extremes, to that extent there is a view of the two extremes, to that extent there is a view of the two extremes, to that extent there is a view of the two extremes, to that extent there is a view of the two extremes, to that extent there is a view of the two extremes, to that extent there is a view of the two extremes, to that extent there is a view of the two extremes, to that extent there is a view of the two extremes, to that extent there is a view of the two extremes, to that extent there is a view of the two extremes, to that extent there is a view of the two extremes, to that extent there is a view of the two extremes, to that extent there is a view of the two extremes, to that extent there is a view of the two extremes, to that extent there is a view of the two extremes, to that extent there is a view of the two extremes, to that

original: gang yang de bzhin gshegs pa chags pa thams cad dang bral ba dang / chags pa thams cad dang bral ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag dang / de ma yin pa'i sems can gzhan rnams kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba gang ji snyed pa de dag thams cad mtshan mar yid la byed cing yid la byas nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo na /
analyzed: gang yang de bzhin gshegs pa chags pa thams cad dang bral ba dang / chags pa thams cad dang bral ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag dang / de ma yin pa'i sems can gzhan rnams kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba gang ji snyed pa de dag thams cad mtshan mar yid la byed cing yid la byas nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo na /
translated: Moreover, if someone were to take as an objective sign all the wholesome roots of the Tathagatas, who are free from all attachment, and of other beings, and having taken them as an objective sign, were to dedicate them to full enlightenment,

original: rab 'byor ji tsam du mtshan mar yid la byed pa de tsam du chags pa'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor ji tsam du mtshan mar yid la byed pa de tsam du chags pa'o //
translated: to that extent, Subhuti, it would be attachment.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: rab 'byor de bzhin gshegs pa ni mtshan mar yid la byar med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rab 'byor de bzhin gshegs pa ni mtshan mar yid la byar med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because, Subhuti, the Tathagatas are not to be taken as an objective sign.🔽And the wholesome roots of those and other beings are not to be taken as an objective sign.

original: de rnams sam gzhan rnams kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba yang mtshan mar yid la byar med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni chags pa phra mo yin no //
analyzed: de rnams sam gzhan rnams kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba yang mtshan mar yid la byar med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni chags pa phra mo yin no //
translated: This is the subtle attachment.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the venerable Subhūti said to the Lord:

original: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni zab po //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni zab po //
translated: “Lord, the perfection of wisdom is profound.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said:

original: rab 'byor chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis dben pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rab 'byor chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis dben pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Subhūti, it is because all dharmas are isolated by their very nature.

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
translated: Subhūti said:

original: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: “Lord, homage to the perfection of wisdom!

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said:

original: rab 'byor de ni 'di ltar ma byas mngon par 'dus ma byas te /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ni 'di ltar ma byas mngon par 'dus ma byas te /
translated: “Subhūti, it is because it is not made, not put together, and no one can fully awaken to it.”

original: de ni sus kyang mngon par 'tshang rgya bar bya bar mi nus so zhes bya ba ni chos zab mo nyid yin no //
analyzed: de ni sus kyang mngon par 'tshang rgya bar bya bar mi nus so zhes bya ba ni chos zab mo nyid yin no //
translated: This is the profundity of the dharma.

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
translated: Subhūti said:

original: bcom ldan 'das chos thams cad ni mngon par rdzogs par byang chub par dka'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das chos thams cad ni mngon par rdzogs par byang chub par dka'o //
translated: “Lord, all dharmas are difficult to fully awaken to.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said:🔽“Subhūti, it is because all dharmas are isolated by their very nature.

original: rab 'byor de ni 'di ltar chos kyi rang bzhin ni gnyis ma yin te /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ni 'di ltar chos kyi rang bzhin ni gnyis ma yin te /
translated: Subhūti, it is because the nature of dharmas is not dual.

original: rab 'byor chos kyi rang bzhin ni gcig tu zad do //
analyzed: rab 'byor chos kyi rang bzhin ni gcig tu zad do //
translated: Subhūti, the nature of dharmas is just one.

original: chos kyi rang bzhin gang yin pa de ni rang bzhin ma yin no //
analyzed: chos kyi rang bzhin gang yin pa de ni rang bzhin ma yin no //
translated: The nature of dharmas is not a nature.

original: gang rang bzhin ma yin pa de ni mngon par 'dus ma byas pa'o //
analyzed: gang rang bzhin ma yin pa de ni mngon par 'dus ma byas pa'o //
translated: What is not a nature is unconditioned.

original: rab 'byor de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos chos kyi rang bzhin gcig por rang bzhin ma yin par mngon par 'dus ma byas pa shes shing mthong na chags pa'i mtha' thams cad yongs su spangs pa yin no zhes bya ba ni chags pa
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos chos kyi rang bzhin gcig por rang bzhin ma yin par mngon par 'dus ma byas pa shes shing mthong na chags pa'i mtha' thams cad yongs su spangs pa yin no zhes bya ba ni chags pa
translated: Subhūti, when bodhisattva great beings know and see the one nature of dharmas as not a nature, as unconditioned, they abandon all extremes of attachment.

original: thams cad spong ba yin no //
analyzed: thams cad spong ba yin no //
translated: This is the abandonment of all attachment.

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
translated: Subhūti said,

original: bcom @154a * //
analyzed: bcom @154a * //
translated: “Blessed One,

original: ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni rtogs par dka' ba'o //
analyzed: ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni rtogs par dka' ba'o //
translated: the perfection of wisdom is difficult to understand.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,🔽“Subhūti,

original: rab 'byor de ni 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni sus kyang ma mthong ma thos ma des rnam par ma shes mngon par sangs rgyas so zhes bya ba ni rtogs par dka' ba yin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor de ni 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni sus kyang ma mthong ma thos ma des rnam par ma shes mngon par sangs rgyas so zhes bya ba ni rtogs par dka' ba yin no //
translated: “Subhūti, it is because the perfection of wisdom has not been seen, heard, distinguished, or known by anyone, and has not been fully awakened to by anyone.”

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
translated: Subhūti said,

original: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'o //
translated: “Blessed One, the perfection of wisdom is inconceivable.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor de ni 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni sus kyang rnam par ma shes te /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ni 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni sus kyang rnam par ma shes te /
translated: “Subhūti, it is because the perfection of wisdom has not been known by anyone.

original: gzugs dang ; tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pas ma shes so //
analyzed: gzugs dang ; tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pas ma shes so //
translated: It has not been known by form, feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness.

original: so so ba dang / bsdus pa'i phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung bas ma shes so //
analyzed: so so ba dang / bsdus pa'i phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung bas ma shes so //
translated: It has not been known by the individual and combined aggregates, elements, sense fields, and dependent origination.

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i yan lag dang / pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams dang / tshad med pa dang / bsam gtan dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams kyis mi shes so //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i yan lag dang / pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams dang / tshad med pa dang / bsam gtan dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams kyis mi shes so //
translated: the factors of awakening, the perfections, the aspects of awakening, the immeasurables, the concentrations, and the formless absorptions do not know it.

original: rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams kyis ma shes so //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams kyis ma shes so //
translated: The eight liberations, the nine serial absorptions, emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness, and the clairvoyances do not know it.

original: stong pa nyid thams cad dang / ting nge 'dzin thams cad dang / gzungs kyi sgo thams cad kyis ma shes so //
analyzed: stong pa nyid thams cad dang / ting nge 'dzin thams cad dang / gzungs kyi sgo thams cad kyis ma shes so //
translated: All emptinesses, all concentrations, and all dhāraṇī gateways do not know it.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang ; sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyis ma shes so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang ; sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyis ma shes so //
translated: The ten tathāgata powers, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha do not know it.

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
translated: Subhūti said,

original: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni bgyid pa po ma mchis pa'o //🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni bgyid pa po ma mchis pa'o // bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord: Because of the nonapprehension of all dharmas.🔽The Lord: Because of the nonapprehension of the doer.

original: rab 'byor chos thams cad mi dmigs pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni byed pa po med pa'o zhes ba ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor chos thams cad mi dmigs pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni byed pa po med pa'o zhes ba ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin no //
translated: This is the inconceivable.

original: 'di dag gis ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang gnyen po'i phyogs gsungs so //🔽rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: 'di dag gis ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang gnyen po'i phyogs gsungs so // rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
translated: Here the adverse elements and the counteragents have been taught.

original: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas ji @154b ltar spyad par bgyi /🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /🔽rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas ji @154b ltar spyad par bgyi / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa / rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: Subhuti: How should a Bodhisattva, a great being, who courses in the perfection of wisdom, go to work?

original: gal te gzugs la mi spyod na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do //
analyzed: gal te gzugs la mi spyod na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do //
translated: The Lord: Here a Bodhisattva, a great being, who courses in the perfection of wisdom, should not go to work in form, etc.

original: gal te tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa la mi spyod na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do //
analyzed: gal te tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa la mi spyod na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do //
translated: If one does not engage with feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness, one engages in the perfection of wisdom.

original: de bzhin du so so ba dang / bsdus pa'i phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la mi spyod na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do //
analyzed: de bzhin du so so ba dang / bsdus pa'i phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la mi spyod na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do //
translated: Similarly, if one does not engage with the individual and composite aggregates, constituents, sense fields, and dependent origination, one engages in the perfection of wisdom.

original: de bzhin du pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / ting nge 'dzin thams cad dang / gzungs kyi sgo thams cad dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams dang / yang dag par spong ba dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / ting nge 'dzin thams cad dang / gzungs kyi sgo thams cad dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams dang / yang dag par spong ba dang /
translated: Similarly, if one does not engage with all the perfections, all the emptinesses, all the meditative stabilizations, all the dhāraṇī gateways, the applications of mindfulness, the right efforts,

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rnams dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa rnams la mi spyod na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rnams dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa rnams la mi spyod na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do //
translated: If one does not practice in the bases of supernatural power, the faculties, the powers, the limbs of enlightenment, and the noble eightfold path, one practices in the perfection of wisdom.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams la mi spyod na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams la mi spyod na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do //
translated: If one does not practice in the noble truths, one practices in the perfection of wisdom.

original: rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa rnams la mi spyod na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa rnams la mi spyod na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do //
translated: If one does not practice in the eight liberations, the nine serial absorptions, emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness, one practices in the perfection of wisdom.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la mi spyod na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la mi spyod na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do //
translated: If they do not engage with the ten tathāgata powers, the fearlessnesses, the detailed and thorough knowledges, or the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha, they practice the perfection of wisdom.🔽If they do not engage with the knowledge of all aspects, they practice the perfection of wisdom.”

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la mi spyod na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa'i sbyor ba yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la mi spyod na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa'i sbyor ba yin no //
translated: This is the application to form and so on.

original: gal te gzugs rtag ces bya ba'am mi rtag ces bya bar mi spyod na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do //🔽gzugs bde zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: gal te gzugs rtag ces bya ba'am mi rtag ces bya bar mi spyod na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do // gzugs bde zhes bya ba'am /
translated: If they do not engage with ‘form is permanent’ or ‘form is impermanent,’ they practice the perfection of wisdom.🔽If they do not engage with ‘form is happiness’

original: sdug bsngal zhes bya bar mi spyod na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do //🔽gzugs bdag ces bya ba'am /
analyzed: sdug bsngal zhes bya bar mi spyod na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do // gzugs bdag ces bya ba'am /
translated: or ‘form is suffering,’ they practice the perfection of wisdom.🔽If they do not engage with ‘form is a self’

original: bdag med ces bya bar mi spyod na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do //
analyzed: bdag med ces bya bar mi spyod na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do //
translated: or ‘form is not a self,’ they practice the perfection of wisdom.

original: gzugs sdug ces bya ba'am /
analyzed: gzugs sdug ces bya ba'am /
translated: If one does not practice with the idea that form is beautiful

original: mi sdug ces bya bar mi spyod na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod @155a * //
analyzed: mi sdug ces bya bar mi spyod na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod @155a * //
translated: or that it is ugly, one practices the perfection of wisdom.

original: do ; / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa rtag ces bya ba'am /
analyzed: do ; / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa rtag ces bya ba'am /
translated: If one does not practice with the idea that feeling, perception, volitional formations, or consciousness is permanent

original: mi rtag ces bya bar mi spyod na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do //🔽rnam par shes pa bde zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: mi rtag ces bya bar mi spyod na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do // rnam par shes pa bde zhes bya ba'am /
translated: or that it is impermanent, one practices the perfection of wisdom.🔽If one does not practice with the idea that consciousness is happiness

original: sdug bsngal zhes bya bar mi spyod na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do //🔽rnam par shes pa bdag ces bya ba'am /
analyzed: sdug bsngal zhes bya bar mi spyod na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do // rnam par shes pa bdag ces bya ba'am /
translated: or that it is suffering, one practices the perfection of wisdom.🔽If one does not practice with the idea that consciousness is a self

original: bdag med ces bya bar mi spyod na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do //🔽rnam par shes ba sdug ces bya ba'am /
analyzed: bdag med ces bya bar mi spyod na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do // rnam par shes ba sdug ces bya ba'am /
translated: or that it is not a self, one practices the perfection of wisdom.🔽If one does not practice with the idea that consciousness is beautiful

original: mi sdug ces bya bar mi spyod na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do //
analyzed: mi sdug ces bya bar mi spyod na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do //
translated: or that it is ugly, one practices the perfection of wisdom.

original: de bzhin du so so ba dang / bsdus pa'i phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i yan lag dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / yang dag par spong ba dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du so so ba dang / bsdus pa'i phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i yan lag dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / yang dag par spong ba dang /
translated: Similarly, the aggregates, whether individually or collectively, the elements, the sense sources, dependent origination, the links of dependent origination, the applications of mindfulness, the correct exertions,

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / lam dang 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / tshad med pa dang / bsam gtan dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / lam dang 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / tshad med pa dang / bsam gtan dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /
translated: the bases of supernatural power, the powers, the branches of enlightenment, the path, the noble truths, the immeasurables, the concentrations, the formless absorptions, emptiness,

original: smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / ting nge 'dzin thams cad dang / gzungs kyi sgo thams cad dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang /
analyzed: smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / ting nge 'dzin thams cad dang / gzungs kyi sgo thams cad dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang /
translated: signlessness, and aspirationlessness, the higher perceptions, all the emptinesses, all the meditative stabilizations, all the dhāraṇī gateways, the ten powers of the tathāgatas, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du rtag ces bya ba'am /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du rtag ces bya ba'am /
translated: If one does not practice in terms of the special qualities of the Buddha, up to the knowledge of all aspects, as permanent or impermanent,

original: mi rtag ces bya bar mi spyod na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do //🔽rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid bde zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: mi rtag ces bya bar mi spyod na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do // rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid bde zhes bya ba'am /
translated: one is practicing the perfection of wisdom.🔽If one does not practice in terms of the knowledge of all aspects as blissful

original: sdug bsngal zhes bya bar mi spyod na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do //🔽rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid bdag ces bya ba'am /
analyzed: sdug bsngal zhes bya bar mi spyod na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do // rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid bdag ces bya ba'am /
translated: or as suffering, one is practicing the perfection of wisdom.🔽If one does not practice in terms of the knowledge of all aspects as a self

original: bdag med ces bya bar mi spyod na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do //🔽rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid sdug ces bya ba'am /
analyzed: bdag med ces bya bar mi spyod na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do // rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid sdug ces bya ba'am /
translated: or as a non-self, one is practicing the perfection of wisdom.🔽If one does not practice in terms of the knowledge of all aspects as attractive

original: mi sdug ces bya bar mi spyod na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do //
analyzed: mi sdug ces bya bar mi spyod na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do //
translated: or as unattractive, one is practicing the perfection of wisdom.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why is that?🔽Because of the emptiness of non-apprehension,

original: gang rtag pa'am mi rtag pa'am /🔽bde ba'am / sdug bsngal ba'am /
analyzed: gang rtag pa'am mi rtag pa'am /🔽bde ba'am / sdug bsngal ba'am /
translated: the emptiness of non-entities,🔽and the emptiness of essential nature.

original: bdag gam bdag med pa'am /🔽sdug pa'am mi sdug par 'gyur ba de bzhin du gzugs de ni med do //
analyzed: bdag gam bdag med pa'am / sdug pa'am mi sdug par 'gyur ba de bzhin du gzugs de ni med do //
translated: that is empty or not empty,🔽that is with signs or signless,🔽that is having aspirations or without aspirations,🔽that is calm or not calm,🔽that is void or not void,🔽that is afflicted or purified,🔽that is generated or extinguished,🔽that is past, future, or present,

original: @155b gang rtag pa'am mi rtag pa'am /
analyzed: @155b gang rtag pa'am mi rtag pa'am /
translated: that is internal or external,🔽that is coarse or subtle,🔽that is inferior or superior,🔽that is far or near,🔽so too there is no feeling, no perception, no volitional factors, and no consciousness that is permanent or impermanent,

original: bde ba'am sdug bsngal ba'am /
analyzed: bde ba'am sdug bsngal ba'am /
translated: that is imbued with happiness or suffering,🔽that is a self or not a self,

original: bdag gam bdag med pa'am /🔽sdug pa'am mi sdug par 'gyur ba de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa de ni med do //
analyzed: bdag gam bdag med pa'am / sdug pa'am mi sdug par 'gyur ba de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa de ni med do //
translated: that is empty or not empty,🔽that is with signs or signless,🔽that is having aspirations or without aspirations,🔽that is calm or not calm,🔽that is void or not void,🔽that is afflicted or purified,🔽that is generated or extinguished,🔽that is past, future, or present,🔽that is internal or external,🔽that is coarse or subtle,🔽that is inferior or superior,🔽that is far or near.

original: de bzhin du gang rtag pa'am mi rtag pa'am /
analyzed: de bzhin du gang rtag pa'am mi rtag pa'am /
translated: “Just as there is no form that is permanent or impermanent,

original: bde pa'am sdug bsngal ba'am /
analyzed: bde pa'am sdug bsngal ba'am /
translated: that is imbued with happiness or suffering,🔽that is a self or not a self,

original: bdag gam bdag med pa'am /
analyzed: bdag gam bdag med pa'am /
translated: that is empty or not empty,🔽that is with signs or signless,🔽that is having aspirations or without aspirations,🔽that is calm or not calm,🔽that is void or not void,🔽that is afflicted or purified,🔽that is generated or extinguished,🔽that is past, future, or present,🔽that is internal or external,🔽that is coarse or subtle,🔽that is inferior or superior,🔽that is far or near,🔽so too there is no form that is the perfection of wisdom,🔽that is the perfection of concentration,🔽the perfection of perseverance,🔽the perfection of patience,🔽the perfection of morality,🔽or the perfection of giving.🔽“Just as there is no form that is the perfection of wisdom,🔽that is the perfection of concentration,🔽the perfection of perseverance,🔽the perfection of patience,🔽the perfection of morality,🔽or the perfection of giving,

original: sdug pa'am mi sdug par 'gyur ba de bzhin du so so ba dang / bsdus pa'i phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba dang / pha rol tu phyin pa dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos dang /
analyzed: sdug pa'am mi sdug par 'gyur ba de bzhin du so so ba dang / bsdus pa'i phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba dang / pha rol tu phyin pa dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos dang /
translated: so too there is no feeling, no perception, no volitional factors, and no consciousness that is the perfection

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /
translated: signlessness,

original: smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / ting nge 'dzin thams cad dang / gzungs kyi sgo thams cad dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang /
analyzed: smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / ting nge 'dzin thams cad dang / gzungs kyi sgo thams cad dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang /
translated: wishlessness, the clairvoyances, all the emptinesses, all the meditative stabilizations, all the dhāraṇī gateways, the ten tathāgata powers, the fearlessnesses, the detailed and thorough knowledges,🔽the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha, up to and the knowledge of all aspects, are nonexistent.”

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar de ni med do zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i sbyor ba yin no /🔽// / bam po sum cu dgu pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar de ni med do zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i sbyor ba yin no /🔽// / bam po sum cu dgu pa /
translated: This is the application of impermanence to form and so on.

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: Furthermore, Subhūti, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom,

original: gal te gzugs yongs su ma rdzogs pa dang rdzogs pa'o zhes bya bar mi spyod na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do //
analyzed: gal te gzugs yongs su ma rdzogs pa dang rdzogs pa'o zhes bya bar mi spyod na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do //
translated: if they do not practice in terms of form as either incomplete or complete, they practice the perfection of wisdom.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa yongs su ma rdzogs pa dang rdzogs pa'o zhes bya bar mi spyod na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa yongs su ma rdzogs pa dang rdzogs pa'o zhes bya bar mi spyod na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do //
translated: If they do not practice in terms of feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness as either incomplete or complete, they practice the perfection of wisdom.

original: de bzhin du so so ba dang / bsdus pa'i phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i yan lag yongs su ma rdzogs pa dang rdzogs pa'o zhes bya bar mi spyod na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do //
analyzed: de bzhin du so so ba dang / bsdus pa'i phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i yan lag yongs su ma rdzogs pa dang rdzogs pa'o zhes bya bar mi spyod na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do //
translated: Similarly, if they do not practice in terms of the individual and composite aggregates, constituents, sense fields, dependent origination, and the factors of dependent origination as either incomplete or complete, they practice the perfection of wisdom.

original: de bzhin du pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / ting nge 'dzin @156a * //
analyzed: de bzhin du pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / ting nge 'dzin @156a * //
translated: Similarly, he does not get involved with the idea that the perfections, the emptinesses, the meditative stabilizations,

original: thams cad dang / gzungs kyi sgo thams cad yongs su ma rdzogs pa dang rdzogs pa'o zhes bya bar mi spyod na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do //
analyzed: thams cad dang / gzungs kyi sgo thams cad yongs su ma rdzogs pa dang rdzogs pa'o zhes bya bar mi spyod na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do //
translated: the dhāraṇī gateways, are incomplete or complete.

original: de bzhin du dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams dang / yang dag par spong ba rnams dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams dang / dbang po rnams dang / stobs rnams dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rnams dang / lam rnams yongs su ma rdzogs pa dang rdzogs pa'o zhes bya bar mi spyod na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do //
analyzed: de bzhin du dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams dang / yang dag par spong ba rnams dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams dang / dbang po rnams dang / stobs rnams dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rnams dang / lam rnams yongs su ma rdzogs pa dang rdzogs pa'o zhes bya bar mi spyod na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do //
translated: Similarly, he does not get involved with the idea that the applications of mindfulness, the right efforts, the legs of magical power, the faculties, the powers, the limbs of awakening, and the path are incomplete or complete.

original: de bzhin du 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams dang / tshad med pa rnams dang / bsam gtan rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang /🔽stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams yongs su ma rdzogs pa dang rdzogs pa'o zhes bya bar mi spyod na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams dang / tshad med pa rnams dang / bsam gtan rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams yongs su ma rdzogs pa dang rdzogs pa'o zhes bya bar mi spyod na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do //
translated: Similarly, they do not engage with the notion that the noble truths, the gateways of meditative stability, the gateways of meditative absorption, the gateways of emptiness, the gateways of signlessness, the gateways of aspirationlessness, the aspects of liberation, the eightfold noble path, the ten powers of the tathāgatas, the four assurances, the four kinds of exact knowledge, and the eighteen distinct qualities of the buddhas are perfected or that they are not perfected.🔽If they do not engage with the notion that the transcendent perfection of wisdom is perfected or that it is not perfected, then they are said to engage in the transcendent perfection of wisdom.
