original: de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad yongs su ma rdzogs pa dang rdzogs pa'o zhes bya bar mi spyod na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do ;
analyzed: de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad yongs su ma rdzogs pa dang rdzogs pa'o zhes bya bar mi spyod na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do ;
translated: Similarly, they do not engage with the notion that the ten powers of the tathāgatas, the four assurances, the four kinds of exact knowledge, and the eighteen distinct qualities of the buddhas are perfected or that they are not perfected.

original: / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du yongs su ma rdzogs pa dang rdzogs pa'o zhes bya bar mi spyod na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do //🔽de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du yongs su ma rdzogs pa dang rdzogs pa'o zhes bya bar mi spyod na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do // de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: If one does not engage with the idea that ‘the knowledge of all aspects is incomplete or complete’, then one engages in the perfection of wisdom.

original: gzugs yongs su ma rdzogs pa dang rdzogs pa gang yin pa de gzugs ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de ltar yang mi spyod na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do //
analyzed: gzugs yongs su ma rdzogs pa dang rdzogs pa gang yin pa de gzugs ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de ltar yang mi spyod na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do //
translated: If one does not engage with the idea that ‘the form that is incomplete or complete is not form’, then one engages in the perfection of wisdom.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa yongs su ma rdzogs pa dang rdzogs pa gang yin pa de rnam par shes pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar mi spyod na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa yongs su ma rdzogs pa dang rdzogs pa gang yin pa de rnam par shes pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar mi spyod na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do //
translated: If one does not engage with the idea that ‘the feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness that are incomplete or complete are not consciousness’, then one engages in the perfection of wisdom.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du yongs su ma rdzogs pa dang rdzogs pa gang yin pa de rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de ltar yang mi spyod na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du yongs su ma rdzogs pa dang rdzogs pa gang yin pa de rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de ltar yang mi spyod na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa
translated: If one does not practice in that way, one practices the perfection of wisdom.

original: la spyod do zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa ma rdzogs pa dang rdzogs pa'i sbyor ba yin no //
analyzed: la spyod do zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa ma rdzogs pa dang rdzogs pa'i sbyor ba yin no //
translated: This is the application to the incomplete and complete forms, etc.

original: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / @156b tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / @156b tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: When this was said, the venerable Subhūti said to the Lord:

original: bcom ldan 'das de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'di rnams la chags pa dang ma chags pa legs par bstan pa ngo mtshar che'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'di rnams la chags pa dang ma chags pa legs par bstan pa ngo mtshar che'o //
translated: Lord, it is amazing how well these bodhisattva great beings have been taught to be attached and not attached.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: rab 'byor de de bzhin te /
analyzed: rab 'byor de de bzhin te /
translated: Subhūti, it is so.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams la chags pa dang ma chags pa legs par bstan to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams la chags pa dang ma chags pa legs par bstan to //
translated: The Tathagata, Arhat, Perfectly Enlightened Buddha has taught well the attachment and non-attachment of the bodhisattva great beings.

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe ;
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe ;
translated: Moreover, Subhuti, when the bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom,

original: gzugs chags pa dang bcas pa dang / ma chags pa zhes bya bar mi spyod na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do //
analyzed: gzugs chags pa dang bcas pa dang / ma chags pa zhes bya bar mi spyod na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do //
translated: if they do not engage with the notion that form is with attachment and without attachment, they practice the perfection of wisdom.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa chags pa dang bcas pa dang / ma chags pa zhes bya bar mi spyod na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa chags pa dang bcas pa dang / ma chags pa zhes bya bar mi spyod na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do //
translated: If they do not engage with the notion that feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are with attachment and without attachment, they practice the perfection of wisdom.

original: mig chags pa dang bcas pa dang / ma chags pa zhes bya bar mi spyod na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do //
analyzed: mig chags pa dang bcas pa dang / ma chags pa zhes bya bar mi spyod na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do //
translated: If they do not engage with the notion that the eyes are with attachment and without attachment, they practice the perfection of wisdom.

original: de bzhin du rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid chags pa dang bcas pa dang / ma chags pa zhes bya bar mi spyod na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do //🔽de bzhin du khams dang / skye mched dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa chags pa dang bcas pa dang / ma chags pa zhes bya bar mi spyod na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do //
analyzed: de bzhin du rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid chags pa dang bcas pa dang / ma chags pa zhes bya bar mi spyod na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do // de bzhin du khams dang / skye mched dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa chags pa dang bcas pa dang / ma chags pa zhes bya bar mi spyod na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do //
translated: Similarly, if one does not practice with the idea that the ear, nose, tongue, body, and thinking mind are with attachment or without attachment, one is practicing the perfection of wisdom.🔽Similarly, if one does not practice with the idea that the constituents, the sense fields, and the perfection of generosity are with attachment or without attachment, one is practicing the perfection of wisdom.

original: de bzhin du tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan rnams dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa chags pa dang bcas pa dang / ma chags pa zhes bya bar mi spyod na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do //
analyzed: de bzhin du tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan rnams dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa chags pa dang bcas pa dang / ma chags pa zhes bya bar mi spyod na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do //
translated: Similarly, if one does not practice with the idea that morality, patience, perseverance, concentration, and the perfection of wisdom are with attachment or without attachment, one is practicing the perfection of wisdom.

original: de bzhin du byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams dang / tshad med pa rnams dang / bsam gtan rnams dang ; gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams chags pa dang bcas pa dang / ma chags pa zhes bya bar mi spyod na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do //
analyzed: de bzhin du byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams dang / tshad med pa rnams dang / bsam gtan rnams dang ; gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams chags pa dang bcas pa dang / ma chags pa zhes bya bar mi spyod na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do //
translated: Similarly, if one does not engage with the thirty-seven aspects of enlightenment, the four noble truths, the immeasurables, the concentrations, and the formless absorptions as being with attachment or without attachment, one engages in the perfection of wisdom.

original: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams dang / stong pa nyid thams cad @157a * //
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams dang / stong pa nyid thams cad @157a * //
translated: If one does not engage with emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness, the clairvoyances, all the emptinesses,

original: chags pa dang bcas pa dang / ma chags pa zhes bya bar mi spyod na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do //
analyzed: chags pa dang bcas pa dang / ma chags pa zhes bya bar mi spyod na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do //
translated: and the four noble truths as being with attachment or without attachment, one engages in the perfection of wisdom.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad rnams dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo thams cad dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid chags pa dang bcas pa dang /🔽ma chags pa zhes bya bar mi spyod na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do //🔽rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ltar spyod na gzugs chags pa dang bcas pa dang / ma chags pa zhes bya bar 'du shes pa med do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad rnams dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo thams cad dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid chags pa dang bcas pa dang / ma chags pa zhes bya bar mi spyod na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do // rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ltar spyod na gzugs chags pa dang bcas pa dang / ma chags pa zhes bya bar 'du shes pa med do //

original: de bzhin du phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba dang / pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba dang / pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang /
translated: Similarly, they do not entertain the idea that the aggregates, elements, sense fields, dependent origination, perfections, all emptinesses, thirty-seven factors of awakening,

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams dang / tshad med pa rnams dang / bsam gtan rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / mngon par shes pa rnams dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams dang / tshad med pa rnams dang / bsam gtan rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / mngon par shes pa rnams dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang /
translated: four noble truths, immeasurables, concentrations, formless absorptions, clairvoyances, emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness,

original: ting nge 'dzin thams cad dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams dang / stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams chags pa dang bcas pa dang / ma chags pa zhes bya bar 'du shes pa med do //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin thams cad dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams dang / stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams chags pa dang bcas pa dang / ma chags pa zhes bya bar 'du shes pa med do //
translated: all meditative stabilizations, dhāraṇī gateways, ten powers, four fearlessnesses, four detailed and thorough knowledges, and eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha are with attachment or without attachment.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid chags pa dang bcas pa dang / ma chags pa zhes bya bar 'du shes pa med do //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid chags pa dang bcas pa dang / ma chags pa zhes bya bar 'du shes pa med do //
translated: There is no perception of the knowledge of all aspects as being with attachment or without attachment.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang byang chub dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub chags pa dang bcas pa dang /
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang byang chub dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub chags pa dang bcas pa dang /
translated: There is no perception of the result of stream enterer, the result of once-returner, the result of non-returner, the state of a worthy one, a pratyekabuddha’s awakening, or unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening as being with attachment or without attachment.”

original: ma chags pa zhes bya bar 'du shes pa med do zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa la chags pa med pa'i sbyor ba yin no //
analyzed: ma chags pa zhes bya bar 'du shes pa med do zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa la chags pa med pa'i sbyor ba yin no //
translated: This is the application to nonattachment to form and so on.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa @157b rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa @157b rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then venerable Subhūti said to the Lord,

original: bcom ldan 'das de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di bstan kyang yongs su mi 'grib ma bstan kyang yongs su mi 'grib /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di bstan kyang yongs su mi 'grib ma bstan kyang yongs su mi 'grib /
translated: “Lord, even though this deep perfection of wisdom is taught, it does not diminish; even though it is not taught, it does not diminish.

original: bstan kyang yongs su mi 'phel /
analyzed: bstan kyang yongs su mi 'phel /
translated: It does not increase when it is taught.

original: ma bstan kyang yongs su mi 'phel ba ngo mtshar che'o //🔽de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: ma bstan kyang yongs su mi 'phel ba ngo mtshar che'o // de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la bka' stsal pa /
translated: It does not increase when it is not taught.

original: rab 'byor de de bzhin no //🔽de de bzhin te /
analyzed: rab 'byor de de bzhin no // de de bzhin te /
translated: The Lord having said that, the venerable Subhūti said to him, “Lord, it is amazing how deep this perfection of wisdom is,🔽how great a perfection of wisdom it is,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di bstan kyang yongs su mi 'grib /🔽ma bstan kyang yongs su mi 'grib /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di bstan kyang yongs su mi 'grib / ma bstan kyang yongs su mi 'grib /
translated: how much it does not increase when it is taught,🔽how much it does not increase when it is not taught,

original: bstan kyang yongs su mi 'phel /
analyzed: bstan kyang yongs su mi 'phel /
translated: how much it does not decrease when it is taught,

original: ma bstan kyang yongs su mi 'phel lo //
analyzed: ma bstan kyang yongs su mi 'phel lo //
translated: and how much it does not decrease when it is not taught.

original: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na /
translated: “To illustrate, Subhūti,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas nam 'tsho'i bar du bzhugs shing nam mkha'i bsngags pa'am /🔽bsngags pa ma yin pa brjod kyang /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas nam 'tsho'i bar du bzhugs shing nam mkha'i bsngags pa'am / bsngags pa ma yin pa brjod kyang /
translated: even if a tathāgata, worthy one, perfectly complete buddha were to live for the duration of a kalpa and speak in praise of or speak in dispraise of space,🔽space would not be increased by speaking in praise of it,

original: nam mkha' la ni bsngags pa brjod pas yongs su 'phel ba med do ;
analyzed: nam mkha' la ni bsngags pa brjod pas yongs su 'phel ba med do ;
translated: and it would not be decreased by speaking in dispraise of it.

original: / bsngags pa ma yin pa brjod pas yongs su 'grib pa med do //
analyzed: / bsngags pa ma yin pa brjod pas yongs su 'grib pa med do //
translated: He is not diminished by the expression of dispraise.

original: nam mkha' ni bsngags pa brjod kyang mi 'phel ba med do //
analyzed: nam mkha' ni bsngags pa brjod kyang mi 'phel ba med do //
translated: Space is not increased by the expression of praise.🔽It is not diminished by the expression of dispraise.

original: bsngags pa ma yin pa brjod kyang mi 'grib pa med do zhes bya ba ni gzhan du mi 'gyur ba'i sbyor ba yin no //
analyzed: bsngags pa ma yin pa brjod kyang mi 'grib pa med do zhes bya ba ni gzhan du mi 'gyur ba'i sbyor ba yin no //
translated: This is the application of the unchanging.

original: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na /
translated: Subhūti, it is like this:

original: sgyu ma'i skyes bu ni bsngags pa brjod kyang 'phel ba med do //🔽bsngags pa ma yin pa brjod kyang yongs su 'grib pa med do //🔽bsngags pa brjod kyang chags par 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: sgyu ma'i skyes bu ni bsngags pa brjod kyang 'phel ba med do // bsngags pa ma yin pa brjod kyang yongs su 'grib pa med do // bsngags pa brjod kyang chags par 'gyur ba med do //
translated: An illusory person is not increased by the expression of praise.🔽He is not diminished by the expression of dispraise.🔽He is not attached by the expression of praise.

original: bsngags pa ma yin pa brjod kyang khong khro bar 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: bsngags pa ma yin pa brjod kyang khong khro bar 'gyur ba med do //
translated: He is not averse by the expression of dispraise.

original: rab 'byor de bzhin du chos rnams kyi chos nyid gang yin pa de bstan kyang de bzhin /
analyzed: rab 'byor de bzhin du chos rnams kyi chos nyid gang yin pa de bstan kyang de bzhin /
translated: Subhūti, in the same way, the reality of phenomena is just as it is🔽whether it is taught or not taught.

original: ma bstan kyang de bzhin no zhes bya ba ni byed pa po ma yin pa'i sbyor ba yin no //
analyzed: ma bstan kyang de bzhin no zhes bya ba ni byed pa po ma yin pa'i sbyor ba yin no //
translated: This is the application of the non-agent.

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
translated: Subhūti said:

original: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: Blessed One, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa na sems zhum pa dang / ba yongs par mi 'gyur ba dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'dir brtson par byed cing bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las slar mi ldog pa na dka' ba bgyid pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa na sems zhum pa dang / ba yongs par mi 'gyur ba dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'dir brtson par byed cing bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las slar mi ldog pa na dka' ba bgyid pa'o //
translated: when the perfection of wisdom is being taught, their minds do not become cowed, they do not become frightened or terrified, and they do not turn back from this perfection of wisdom. They exert themselves in it and do not turn back from unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening. They do difficult things.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bcom ldan 'das 'di lta ste byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi shes rab kyi pha @158a * //🔽rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa 'di ni nam mkha' bsgom pa'i slad du ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'di lta ste byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi shes rab kyi pha @158a * // rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa 'di ni nam mkha' bsgom pa'i slad du ste /
translated: Blessed One, the cultivation of the perfection of wisdom of bodhisattva great beings is a cultivation of space.

original: nam mkha' la ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par btags pa ma mchis so //
analyzed: nam mkha' la ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par btags pa ma mchis so //
translated: Because space is not designated as the perfection of wisdom.

original: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin par ma mchis so //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin par ma mchis so //
translated: It is not designated as the perfection of concentration.

original: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin par ma mchis so //
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin par ma mchis so //
translated: it is not the perfection of perseverance,

original: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin par ma mchis so //
analyzed: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin par ma mchis so //
translated: it is not the perfection of patience,

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin par ma mchis so //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin par ma mchis so //
translated: it is not the perfection of morality,

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin par btags pa ma mchis so //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin par btags pa ma mchis so //
translated: it is not the perfection of generosity,

original: nam mkha' la ni gzugs su btags pa ma mchis so //🔽tshor bar ma mchis so //
analyzed: nam mkha' la ni gzugs su btags pa ma mchis so // tshor bar ma mchis so //
translated: it is not the designation of form in space,🔽it is not feeling,

original: 'du shes su ma mchis /
analyzed: 'du shes su ma mchis /
translated: it is not perception,

original: 'du byed rnams su ma mchis /
analyzed: 'du byed rnams su ma mchis /
translated: it is not volitional factors,

original: nam mkha' la ni rnam par shes par btags pa ma mchis so //
analyzed: nam mkha' la ni rnam par shes par btags pa ma mchis so //
translated: it is not the designation of consciousness in space,

original: nam mkha' la ni nang stong pa nyid du btags pa ma mchis so //🔽phyi stong pa nyid du btags pa ma mchis so //
analyzed: nam mkha' la ni nang stong pa nyid du btags pa ma mchis so // phyi stong pa nyid du btags pa ma mchis so //
translated: it is not the designation of inner emptiness in space,🔽it is not the designation of outer emptiness in space,

original: phyi nang stong pa nyid du btags pa ma mchis so //
analyzed: phyi nang stong pa nyid du btags pa ma mchis so //
translated: it is not the designation of inner and outer emptiness in space,

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar du btags pa ma mchis so //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar du btags pa ma mchis so //
translated: up to it is not the designation of the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature in space,

original: nam mkha' la ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams su btags pa ma mchis so //
analyzed: nam mkha' la ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams su btags pa ma mchis so //
translated: it is not the designation of the applications of mindfulness in space,

original: nam mkha' la ni yang dag par spong pa rnams dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams dang / dbang po rnams dang / stobs rnams dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rnams dang / lam rnams su btags pa ma mchis so //
analyzed: nam mkha' la ni yang dag par spong pa rnams dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams dang / dbang po rnams dang / stobs rnams dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rnams dang / lam rnams su btags pa ma mchis so //
translated: In space, the right efforts, legs of miraculous power, faculties, powers, limbs of awakening, and path are not imputed.

original: nam mkha' la ni 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams su btags pa ma mchis so //
analyzed: nam mkha' la ni 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams su btags pa ma mchis so //
translated: In space, the noble truths are not imputed.

original: tshad med pa rnams dang / bsam gtan rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams su btags pa ma mchis so //
analyzed: tshad med pa rnams dang / bsam gtan rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams su btags pa ma mchis so //
translated: The immeasurables, concentrations, and formless absorptions are not imputed.

original: nam mkha' la ni rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgur btags pa ma mchis so //
analyzed: nam mkha' la ni rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgur btags pa ma mchis so //
translated: In space, the eight deliverances and nine serial absorptions are not imputed.

original: nam mkha' la ni stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams su btags pa ma mchis so //
analyzed: nam mkha' la ni stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams su btags pa ma mchis so //
translated: In space, the emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness and the clairvoyances are not imputed.

original: nam mkha' la ni ting nge 'dzin rnams dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams su btags pa ma mchis so //
analyzed: nam mkha' la ni ting nge 'dzin rnams dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams su btags pa ma mchis so //
translated: The meditative stabilities and dhāraṇī gateways are not imputed in space.

original: nam mkha' la ni zhi gnas dang lhag mthong du btags pa ma mchis so //
analyzed: nam mkha' la ni zhi gnas dang lhag mthong du btags pa ma mchis so //
translated: Calm abiding and profound insight are not imputed in space.

original: nam mkha' la ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcur btags pa ma mchis so //
analyzed: nam mkha' la ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcur btags pa ma mchis so //
translated: The ten powers of the tathāgatas are not imputed in space.

original: nam mkha' la ni mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhir @158b btags pa ma mchis so //
analyzed: nam mkha' la ni mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhir @158b btags pa ma mchis so //
translated: The four fearlessnesses and the four detailed and thorough knowledges are not imputed in space.

original: nam mkha' la ni sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad du btags pa ma mchis so //
analyzed: nam mkha' la ni sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad du btags pa ma mchis so //
translated: The eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha are not imputed in space.

original: nam mkha' la ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bur btags pa ma mchis so //🔽nam mkha' la ni lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bur btags pa ma mchis so //
analyzed: nam mkha' la ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bur btags pa ma mchis so // nam mkha' la ni lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bur btags pa ma mchis so //
translated: The result of stream enterer is not imputed in space.🔽The result of once-returner is not imputed in space.

original: nam mkha' la ni lan cig phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bur btags pa ma mchis so //
analyzed: nam mkha' la ni lan cig phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bur btags pa ma mchis so //
translated: The result of non-returner is not imputed in space.

original: nam mkha' la ni dgra bcom pa nyid du btags pa ma mchis so //
analyzed: nam mkha' la ni dgra bcom pa nyid du btags pa ma mchis so //
translated: Arhatship is not imputed in space.

original: nam mkha' la ni rang byang chub tu btags pa ma mchis so //
analyzed: nam mkha' la ni rang byang chub tu btags pa ma mchis so //
translated: In space there is no designation of a pratyekabuddha.

original: nam mkha' la ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu btags pa ma mchis so //
analyzed: nam mkha' la ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu btags pa ma mchis so //
translated: In space there is no designation of unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
translated: Subhūti said,

original: bcom ldan 'das gang gis go cha 'di 'tshal ba'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gang gis go cha 'di 'tshal ba'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: “Blessed One, I pay homage to the bodhisattva great beings who don the armor of this.

original: bcom ldan 'das gang gis go cha 'di bgos pa de dag ni nam mkha'i don du sbyor bar 'tshal /🔽bskul bar 'tshal /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gang gis go cha 'di bgos pa de dag ni nam mkha'i don du sbyor bar 'tshal / bskul bar 'tshal /
translated: Blessed One, those who don the armor of this will know how to apply themselves to space,

original: khyab par 'tshal ba dag ste /
analyzed: khyab par 'tshal ba dag ste /
translated: will know how to encourage themselves,🔽and will know how to pervade it.

original: bcom ldan 'das gang gis sems can rnams kyi slad du go cha bgos pa de dag ni nam mkha' yongs su dgrol bar 'tshal lo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gang gis sems can rnams kyi slad du go cha bgos pa de dag ni nam mkha' yongs su dgrol bar 'tshal lo //
translated: Blessed One, those who don the armor of this for the sake of sentient beings will know how to liberate space.

original: bcom ldan 'das sems can rnams kyi slad du go cha bgos pa de dag ni go cha chen po bgos pa lags te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das sems can rnams kyi slad du go cha bgos pa de dag ni go cha chen po bgos pa lags te /
translated: Blessed One, those who don the armor of this for the sake of sentient beings don the great armor.

original: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po nam mkha' dang mnyam pa'i chos rnams kyi slad du go cha bgos pa'o zhes bya ba ni ched du bya ba dka' ba'i sbyor ba yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po nam mkha' dang mnyam pa'i chos rnams kyi slad du go cha bgos pa'o zhes bya ba ni ched du bya ba dka' ba'i sbyor ba yin no //
translated: Blessed One, the bodhisattva great beings are armored for the sake of the dharmas that are equal to space.

original: bcom ldan 'das sems can rnams kyi don du go cha 'chal ba de dag ni nam mkha' bar snang la ldeg par 'tshal ba'o zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba dka' ba nyid kyi sbyor ba yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das sems can rnams kyi don du go cha 'chal ba de dag ni nam mkha' bar snang la ldeg par 'tshal ba'o zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba dka' ba nyid kyi sbyor ba yin no //
translated: Blessed One, those who are armored for the sake of sentient beings are known to be armored for the sake of space.

original: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang sems can rnams kyi slad du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'tshal ba de dag ni brtson 'grus chen po thob pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang sems can rnams kyi slad du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'tshal ba de dag ni brtson 'grus chen po thob pa'o //
translated: Blessed One, the bodhisattva great beings who seek unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening for the sake of sentient beings have attained great diligence.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bcom ldan 'das gal te stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di /🔽'di lta ste dper na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gal te stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di / 'di lta ste dper na /
translated: Blessed One, if this trichiliocosm were filled🔽with tathāgatas, arhats, perfectly awakened buddhas,

original: 'dam bu'i tshal lam /
analyzed: 'dam bu'i tshal lam /
translated: like a thicket of reeds,

original: 'od ma'i tshal lam /
analyzed: 'od ma'i tshal lam /
translated: a grove of reeds,

original: bu ram shing gi tshal lam /🔽'bras kyi zhing ltar de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis yongs su gang bar gyur la de bzhin gshegs pa de dag gis kyang bskal pa'am /🔽bskal pa las @159a * //
analyzed: bu ram shing gi tshal lam / 'bras kyi zhing ltar de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis yongs su gang bar gyur la de bzhin gshegs pa de dag gis kyang bskal pa'am / bskal pa las @159a * //
translated: a grove of sugar cane,

original: lhag par chos bstan te /
analyzed: lhag par chos bstan te /
translated: or a field of rice, and those thus-gone ones were to teach the Dharma for an eon or more,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa re res sems can tshad ma mchis /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa re res sems can tshad ma mchis /
translated: and each thus-gone one were to lead countless, innumerable, and limitless sentient beings to complete nirvāṇa, Blessed One, the realm of sentient beings would not be diminished or filled.🔽Why is that?

original: grangs ma mchis /
analyzed: grangs ma mchis /
translated: Because sentient beings do not exist and sentient beings are void.🔽In the same way, in each of the ten directions, in world systems as numerous as the sands of the River Ganges, if each of those thus-gone ones were to teach the Dharma for an eon or more, and each thus-gone one were to lead countless, innumerable, and limitless sentient beings to complete nirvāṇa, Blessed One, the realm of sentient beings would not be diminished or filled.🔽Why is that?🔽Because sentient beings do not exist and sentient beings are void.

original: gzhal du ma mchis pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das kyang bcom ldan 'das sems can gyi khams la 'bri ba'am gang bar btags pa mi gda'o //
analyzed: gzhal du ma mchis pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das kyang bcom ldan 'das sems can gyi khams la 'bri ba'am gang bar btags pa mi gda'o //
translated: In the same way, in each of the ten directions, in world systems as numerous as the sands of the River Ganges, if each of those thus-gone ones were to teach the Dharma for an eon or more, and each thus-gone one were to lead countless, innumerable, and limitless sentient beings to complete nirvāṇa, Blessed One, the realm of sentient beings would not be diminished or filled.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sems can ma mchis pa'i slad du dang / sems can dben pa'i slad du'o //
analyzed: sems can ma mchis pa'i slad du dang / sems can dben pa'i slad du'o //
translated: Because sentient beings do not exist and sentient beings are void.

original: de bzhin du phyogs bcu'i phyogs re re zhing yang 'jig rten gyi khams gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag 'di lta ste dper na /
analyzed: de bzhin du phyogs bcu'i phyogs re re zhing yang 'jig rten gyi khams gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag 'di lta ste dper na /
translated: In the same way, in each of the ten directions, in world systems as numerous as the sands of the River Ganges, if each of those thus-gone ones were to teach the Dharma for an eon or more, and each thus-gone one were to lead countless, innumerable, and limitless sentient beings to complete nirvāṇa, Blessed One, the realm of sentient beings would not be diminished or filled.

original: 'dam bu'i tshal lam /
analyzed: 'dam bu'i tshal lam /
translated: Why is that?🔽Because sentient beings do not exist and sentient beings are void.🔽In the same way, in each of the ten directions, in world systems as numerous as the sands of the River Ganges, if each of those thus-gone ones were to teach the Dharma for an eon or more, and each thus-gone one were to lead countless, innumerable, and limitless sentient beings to complete nirvāṇa, Blessed One, the realm of sentient beings would not be diminished or filled.🔽Why is that?🔽Because sentient beings do not exist and sentient beings are void.

original: 'od ma'i tshal lam /
analyzed: 'od ma'i tshal lam /
translated: In the same way, in each of the

original: bu ram shing gi tshal lam /🔽'bras kyi zhing ltar de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis yongs su gang bar gyur la de bzhin gshegs pa de dag gis kyang bskal pa'am /
analyzed: bu ram shing gi tshal lam / 'bras kyi zhing ltar de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis yongs su gang bar gyur la de bzhin gshegs pa de dag gis kyang bskal pa'am /
translated: like a sugar cane field,

original: bskal pa las lhag par chos bstan te /🔽de bzhin gshegs pa re res sems can tshad ma mchis pa grangs ma mchis pa /
analyzed: bskal pa las lhag par chos bstan te / de bzhin gshegs pa re res sems can tshad ma mchis pa grangs ma mchis pa /
translated: or a field of rice, and the tathāgatas were to teach the Dharma for an eon or more,

original: gzhal du ma mchis pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das kyang sems can gyi khams la 'bri ba'am gang bar btags pa mi gda'o //
analyzed: gzhal du ma mchis pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das kyang sems can gyi khams la 'bri ba'am gang bar btags pa mi gda'o //
translated: and each tathāgata were to lead countless, innumerable, immeasurable sentient beings to complete nirvāṇa, still the realm of sentient beings would neither decrease nor increase.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sems can ma mchis pa'i slad du dang sems can dben pa'i slad du ste /
analyzed: sems can ma mchis pa'i slad du dang sems can dben pa'i slad du ste /
translated: It is because sentient beings do not exist and sentient beings are void.

original: bcom ldan 'das rnam grangs des na sems can rnams kyi slad du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'tshal ba de dag ni nam mkha' yongs su dgrol bar 'tshal ba lags zhes mchi'o zhes bya ba
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rnam grangs des na sems can rnams kyi slad du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'tshal ba de dag ni nam mkha' yongs su dgrol bar 'tshal ba lags zhes mchi'o zhes bya ba
translated: Blessed One, for this reason, those who wish to fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening for the sake of sentient beings are said to wish to liberate space.”

original: ni las bya dka' ba nyid kyi sbyor ba yin no //
analyzed: ni las bya dka' ba nyid kyi sbyor ba yin no //
translated: This is the application of the difficulty of the action.

original: de nas dge slong gzhan zhig gis 'di snyam du gyur te /
analyzed: de nas dge slong gzhan zhig gis 'di snyam du gyur te /
translated: Then another monk thought this:

original: gang la chos gang yang skye ba'am 'gag pa yang med la /
analyzed: gang la chos gang yang skye ba'am 'gag pa yang med la /
translated: “For whom is there no arising or cessation of any dharma at all,

original: tshul khrims kyi phung por gdags su yod /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi phung por gdags su yod /
translated: and for whom is there the designation of the aggregate of morality,

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi phung por gdags su yod /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi phung por gdags su yod /
translated: the designation of the aggregate of meditative stabilization,

original: shes rab kyi phung por gdags su yod /
analyzed: shes rab kyi phung por gdags su yod /
translated: the designation of the aggregate of wisdom,

original: rnam par grol ba'i phung por gdags su yod /
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i phung por gdags su yod /
translated: the designation of the aggregate of liberation,

original: rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba'i phung por gdags su yod /
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba'i phung por gdags su yod /
translated: and the designation of the aggregate of the vision and knowledge of liberation,

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bur gdags su yod /
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bur gdags su yod /
translated: and for whom is there the designation of the result of stream enterer,

original: lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bur gdags su yod /
analyzed: lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bur gdags su yod /
translated: the result of once-returner can be designated,

original: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bur gdags su yod /
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bur gdags su yod /
translated: the result of non-returner can be designated,

original: dgra bcom pa nyid du gdags su yod /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa nyid du gdags su yod /
translated: the state of a worthy one can be designated,

original: rang byang chub tu gdags su yod /
analyzed: rang byang chub tu gdags su yod /
translated: solitary awakening can be designated,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas su @159b gdags su yod /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas su @159b gdags su yod /
translated: a tathāgata, worthy one, perfectly complete buddha can be designated,

original: dkon mchog gsum du gdags su yod /
analyzed: dkon mchog gsum du gdags su yod /
translated: the Three Jewels can be designated,

original: chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bar gdags su yod pa'i bcom ldan 'das ma shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la phyag 'tshal lo snyam pa dang zhes bya ba ni don yod pa'i sbyor ba yin no //
analyzed: chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bar gdags su yod pa'i bcom ldan 'das ma shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la phyag 'tshal lo snyam pa dang zhes bya ba ni don yod pa'i sbyor ba yin no //
translated: and the turning of the wheel of the Dharma can be designated.”

original: de nas lha rnams kyi dbang po brgya byin gyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de nas lha rnams kyi dbang po brgya byin gyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Then Śatakratu, head of the gods, said to venerable Subhūti,🔽“Venerable Subhūti, what is the perfection of wisdom?

original: btsun pa rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la brtson par byed pa zhig yod na de gang la brtson par byed pa yin /
analyzed: btsun pa rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la brtson par byed pa zhig yod na de gang la brtson par byed pa yin /
translated: “Venerable Subhūti, if there is a bodhisattva great being who strives in this profound perfection of wisdom, what is it that they strive in?”

original: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
translated: Subhūti replied:

original: koo shi ka gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la bslab par bya bar sems pa de dag ni nam mkha' la brtson pa'o //
analyzed: koo shi ka gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la bslab par bya bar sems pa de dag ni nam mkha' la brtson pa'o //
translated: “Kauśika, those who think that they should train in this profound perfection of wisdom are striving in space.”

original: de nas lha rnams kyi dbang po brgya byin gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas lha rnams kyi dbang po brgya byin gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then Śatakratu, head of the gods, said to the Blessed One,

original: bcom ldan 'das rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: “Blessed One, a son of a good family🔽or a daughter of a good family

original: rigs kyi bu mo gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di 'dzin par 'gyur /🔽'chang bar 'gyur /🔽klog par 'gyur /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di 'dzin par 'gyur / 'chang bar 'gyur / klog par 'gyur /
translated: who takes up this perfection of wisdom,🔽bears it in mind,🔽recites it,

original: kun chub par bgyid par 'gyur /
analyzed: kun chub par bgyid par 'gyur /
translated: masters it,

original: tshul bzhin du yid la bgyid par 'gyur ba de dag la bcom ldan 'das bdag gis bsrung ba dang / bskyab pa dang / sba ba ji lta bu zhig tu bgyi /
analyzed: tshul bzhin du yid la bgyid par 'gyur ba de dag la bcom ldan 'das bdag gis bsrung ba dang / bskyab pa dang / sba ba ji lta bu zhig tu bgyi /
translated: Blessed One, how should I protect, guard, and conceal those who will practice this perfection of wisdom in the right way?

original: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
translated: Subhūti said,

original: koo shi ka gang khyod kyis gang la bsrung ba dang / bskyab pa dang / sba bar bya ba'i chos de lta bu yang dag par rjes su mthong ngam /
analyzed: koo shi ka gang khyod kyis gang la bsrung ba dang / bskyab pa dang / sba bar bya ba'i chos de lta bu yang dag par rjes su mthong ngam /
translated: “Kauśika, do you see any dharma at all that you should protect, guard, and conceal?”

original: brgya byin gyis smras pa /
analyzed: brgya byin gyis smras pa /
translated: Śakra said,

original: btsun pa rab 'byor bdag gis gang la bsrung ba dang / bskyab pa dang / sba bar bya ba de lta bu'i chos yang dag par rjes su ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: btsun pa rab 'byor bdag gis gang la bsrung ba dang / bskyab pa dang / sba bar bya ba de lta bu'i chos yang dag par rjes su ma mthong ngo //
translated: “Venerable Subhūti, I do not see any dharma at all that I should protect, guard, and conceal.”

original: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /🔽koo shi ka gal te rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis smras pa / koo shi ka gal te rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: Subhūti said,

original: rigs kyi bu mo ji skad bstan pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas na de nyid de'i bsrung ba dang / bskyab pa dang / sba bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo ji skad bstan pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas na de nyid de'i bsrung ba dang / bskyab pa dang / sba bar 'gyur ro //
translated: “Kauśika, if a son of a good family or a daughter of a good family abides in the perfection of wisdom as it has been taught, that itself will be their protection, guard, and concealment.”

original: gal te ji skad bstan pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang bral bar gyur na de la mi'am mi ma yin pa glags tshol ba rnams kyis glags rnyed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te ji skad bstan pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang bral bar gyur na de la mi'am mi ma yin pa glags tshol ba rnams kyis glags rnyed par 'gyur ro //
translated: If they were to be without the perfection of wisdom as it has been taught, then humans or non-humans seeking an opportunity would find an opportunity with them.

original: koo shi ka byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod ba rnams la bsrung ba dang / bskyab pa dang / sba bar sems pa de dag ni nam mkha' la bsrung ba dang / bskyab pa dang /🔽sba bar sems pa'o //
analyzed: koo shi ka byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod ba rnams la bsrung ba dang / bskyab pa dang / sba bar sems pa de dag ni nam mkha' la bsrung ba dang / bskyab pa dang / sba bar sems pa'o //
translated: Kauśika, those who want to protect, guard, and conceal the bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom are trying to protect, guard, and conceal space.

original: koo shi ka de ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: koo shi ka de ji snyam du sems /
translated: Kauśika, what do you think?

original: khyod kyis sgyu ma dang / smig rgyu dang / @160a * //
analyzed: khyod kyis sgyu ma dang / smig rgyu dang / @160a * //
translated: Can you protect, guard, and conceal illusions, mirages,

original: rmi lam dang / sgra brnyan dang / mig yor dang / gzugs brnyan dang / dri za'i grong khyer rnams la bsrung ba dang / bskyab pa dang / sba bar nus sam /
analyzed: rmi lam dang / sgra brnyan dang / mig yor dang / gzugs brnyan dang / dri za'i grong khyer rnams la bsrung ba dang / bskyab pa dang / sba bar nus sam /
translated: dreams, echoes, optical aberrations, reflections of the moon in water, and cities of gandharvas?”

original: brgya byin gyis smras pa /
analyzed: brgya byin gyis smras pa /
translated: Śakra, Lord of the Gods, replied,

original: btsun pa rab 'byor de ni mi nus so //
analyzed: btsun pa rab 'byor de ni mi nus so //
translated: “No, Venerable Subhūti, I cannot.”

original: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
translated: Subhūti said,🔽“Kauśika, what do you think?

original: koo shi ka de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa rnams la bsrung ba dang / bskyab pa dang / sba bar gang sems pa de ni bsams pa ltar mi 'grub cing dub ba'i skal ba can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: koo shi ka de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa rnams la bsrung ba dang / bskyab pa dang / sba bar gang sems pa de ni bsams pa ltar mi 'grub cing dub ba'i skal ba can du 'gyur ro //
translated: “Similarly, Kauśika, those who think to protect, guard, and conceal the bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom will not succeed in their thoughts and will have a share in weariness.

original: koo shi ka de ji snyam du sems /🔽khyod kyis de bzhin gshegs pa'am /
analyzed: koo shi ka de ji snyam du sems / khyod kyis de bzhin gshegs pa'am /
translated: “What do you think, Kauśika?🔽Can you protect, guard, and conceal the Tathāgata

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa la bsrung ba dang / bskyab pa dang / sba bar nus sam /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa la bsrung ba dang / bskyab pa dang / sba bar nus sam /
translated: or the Tathāgata’s emanation?”

original: brgya byin gyis smras pa /
analyzed: brgya byin gyis smras pa /
translated: Śatakratu replied,

original: btsun pa rab 'byor de ni mi nus so //
analyzed: btsun pa rab 'byor de ni mi nus so //
translated: “No, Venerable Subhūti, I cannot.”

original: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
translated: Subhūti said,🔽“Kauśika, it is just so.

original: koo shi ka de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa rnams la bsrung ba dang / bskyab pa dang / sba bar gang sems pa de ni bsams pa ltar mi 'grub cing dub pa'i skal ba can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: koo shi ka de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa rnams la bsrung ba dang / bskyab pa dang / sba bar gang sems pa de ni bsams pa ltar mi 'grub cing dub pa'i skal ba can du 'gyur ro //
translated: “Similarly, Kauśika, those who think to protect, guard, and conceal the bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom will not succeed in their thoughts and will have a life of weariness.

original: koo shi ka de ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: koo shi ka de ji snyam du sems /
translated: “Kauśika, what do you think?

original: khyod kyis chos kyi dbyings dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' dang / de bzhin nyid dang / bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dbyings la bsrung ba dang / bskyab pa dang / sba bar nus sam /🔽brgya byin gyis smras pa /
analyzed: khyod kyis chos kyi dbyings dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' dang / de bzhin nyid dang / bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dbyings la bsrung ba dang / bskyab pa dang / sba bar nus sam / brgya byin gyis smras pa /
translated: Can you protect, guard, and conceal the dharma-constituent, the very limit of reality, suchness, and the inconceivable element?”

original: btsun pa rab 'byor de ni mi nus so //
analyzed: btsun pa rab 'byor de ni mi nus so //
translated: Śatakratu replied, “No, Venerable Subhūti, I cannot.”

original: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
translated: Subhūti said,🔽“Kauśika, it is because the dharma-constituent is not something that can be protected, guarded, and concealed.

original: koo shi ka de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa rnams la bsrung ba dang / bskyab pa dang / sba bar gang sems pa de ni bsams pa ltar mi 'grub cing dub pa'i skal ba can du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi rkyen gyis mi 'gro pa'i sbyor ba yin no //
analyzed: koo shi ka de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa rnams la bsrung ba dang / bskyab pa dang / sba bar gang sems pa de ni bsams pa ltar mi 'grub cing dub pa'i skal ba can du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi rkyen gyis mi 'gro pa'i sbyor ba yin no //
translated: Similarly, Kauśika, whoever thinks to protect, guard, and conceal the bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom will not succeed in their thoughts and will have the misfortune of exhaustion.

original: brgya byin gyis smras pa /
analyzed: brgya byin gyis smras pa /
translated: Śakra said,

original: btsun pa rab 'byor ji tsam gyis na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod na chos thams cad rmi lam lta bu dang / sgyu ma lta bu dang / smig rgyu lta bu dang / sgra brnyan lta bu dang /
analyzed: btsun pa rab 'byor ji tsam gyis na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod na chos thams cad rmi lam lta bu dang / sgyu ma lta bu dang / smig rgyu lta bu dang / sgra brnyan lta bu dang /
translated: “Venerable Subhūti, how is it that when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom, they understand all phenomena to be like a dream, like an illusion, like a mirage, like an echo,

original: gzugs brnyan lta bu dang / dri za'i grong khyer lta bu dang / sprul pa lta bur chos thams cad yongs su shes par 'gyur ba yin /
analyzed: gzugs brnyan lta bu dang / dri za'i grong khyer lta bu dang / sprul pa lta bur chos thams cad yongs su shes par 'gyur ba yin /
translated: like an optical illusion, like a city of gandharvas, and like a magical creation?”🔽“Kauśika, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom, they do not see any phenomenon that is not empty of its own mark.

original: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
translated: Subhūti replied:

original: gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpa' @160b sems dpa' chen pos rmi lam rlom sems su mi byed /🔽rmi lam gyis rlom sems su mi byed /
analyzed: gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpa' @160b sems dpa' chen pos rmi lam rlom sems su mi byed / rmi lam gyis rlom sems su mi byed /
translated: “When bodhisattva great beings do not falsely project dreams,🔽do not falsely project because of dreams,

original: rmi lam la rlom sems su mi byed /
analyzed: rmi lam la rlom sems su mi byed /
translated: do not falsely project dreams,

original: de bzhin du sprul pa'i bar du rlom sems su mi byed /🔽sprul pas rlom sems su mi byed /
analyzed: de bzhin du sprul pa'i bar du rlom sems su mi byed / sprul pas rlom sems su mi byed /
translated: and similarly, up to do not falsely project emanations,🔽do not falsely project because of emanations,

original: sprul pa la rlom sems su mi byed pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: sprul pa la rlom sems su mi byed pa de'i tshe /
translated: and do not falsely project emanations,🔽at that time bodhisattva great beings understand all phenomena to be like illusions and all phenomena to be like emanations.”

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos chos thams cad sgyu ma lta bu dang / chos thams cad sprul pa lta bu'i bar du yongs su shes par 'gyur ba yin no zhes bya ba ni rnam pa bdun du snang pa'i shes pa'i sbyor ba yin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos chos thams cad sgyu ma lta bu dang / chos thams cad sprul pa lta bu'i bar du yongs su shes par 'gyur ba yin no zhes bya ba ni rnam pa bdun du snang pa'i shes pa'i sbyor ba yin te /
translated: This is the application of the consciousness that appears as the seven aspects.

original: 'di dag gis ni sbyor ba gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di dag gis ni sbyor ba gsungs so //
translated: This explains the application.

original: koo shi ka gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: koo shi ka gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: “Furthermore, Kauśika, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom,

original: gzugs rlom sems su mi byed /
analyzed: gzugs rlom sems su mi byed /
translated: They do not falsely project form.

original: gzugs kyis rlom sems su mi byed /
analyzed: gzugs kyis rlom sems su mi byed /
translated: They do not falsely project through form.

original: gzugs bdag gi zhes rlom sems su mi byed /
analyzed: gzugs bdag gi zhes rlom sems su mi byed /
translated: They do not falsely project, ‘Form is mine.’

original: gzugs la rlom sems su mi byed /🔽rmi lam rlom sems su mi byed /
analyzed: gzugs la rlom sems su mi byed / rmi lam rlom sems su mi byed /
translated: They do not falsely project onto form.🔽They do not falsely project dreams.

original: rmi lam gyis rlom sems su mi byed /
analyzed: rmi lam gyis rlom sems su mi byed /
translated: They do not falsely project through dreams.

original: rmi lam bdag gi zhes rlom sems su mi byed /
analyzed: rmi lam bdag gi zhes rlom sems su mi byed /
translated: They do not falsely project, ‘Dreams are mine.’

original: rmi lam la rlom sems su mi byed do //🔽sprul pa'i bar du rlom sems su mi byed //
analyzed: rmi lam la rlom sems su mi byed do // sprul pa'i bar du rlom sems su mi byed //

original: sprul pas rlom sems su mi byed /
analyzed: sprul pas rlom sems su mi byed /

original: sprul pa bdag gi zhes rlom sems su mi byed /
analyzed: sprul pa bdag gi zhes rlom sems su mi byed /
translated: They do not falsely project, ‘Emanations are mine.’

original: sprul pa la rlom sems su mi byed do //
analyzed: sprul pa la rlom sems su mi byed do //

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa rlom sems su mi byed /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa rlom sems su mi byed /
translated: They do not falsely project feelings, perceptions, formative predispositions, or consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pas rlom sems su mi byed /
analyzed: rnam par shes pas rlom sems su mi byed /

original: rnam par shes pa bdag gi zhes rlom sems su mi byed /

analyzed: rnam par shes pa la rlom sems su mi byed /

analyzed: rmi lam rlom sems su mi byed ;

translated: They do not falsely project dreams.

translated: They do not falsely project dreams.🔽They do not falsely project up to emanations.

original: sprul pa bdag gi zhes rlom sems su mi byed /

translated: They do not falsely project, ‘Emanations are mine.’

original: sprul pa la rlom sems su mi byed /
analyzed: sprul pa la rlom sems su mi byed /
translated: They do not falsely project emanations.

original: de bzhin du so so ba dang / bsdus pa'i phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i yan lag dang / pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / ting nge 'dzin thams cad dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du so so ba dang / bsdus pa'i phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i yan lag dang / pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / ting nge 'dzin thams cad dang /
translated: Similarly, they do not falsely project the individual aspects, the aggregates, the constituents, the sense fields, the links of dependent origination, all the perfections, all emptinesses, all the meditative stabilizations,

original: gzungs kyi sgo thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs @161a * //
analyzed: gzungs kyi sgo thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs @161a * //
translated: all the dhāraṇī gateways, the aspects of awakening,

original: kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams dang / tshad med pa rnams dang / bsam gtan rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / rnam par thar ba brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang /
analyzed: kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams dang / tshad med pa rnams dang / bsam gtan rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / rnam par thar ba brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang /
translated: the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening, the noble truths, the immeasurables, the concentrations, the formless absorptions, the eight deliverances, the nine serial absorptions,

original: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams dang / stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dang /🔽rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du rlom sems su mi byed /🔽rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyis rlom sems su mi byed /
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams dang / stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du rlom sems su mi byed / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyis rlom sems su mi byed /
translated: emptiness, signlessness, and aspirationlessness, the clairvoyances, the ten powers, the fearlessnesses, the detailed and thorough knowledges, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha,🔽up to the knowledge of all aspects, they do not falsely project it;🔽they do not falsely project the knowledge of all aspects;

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid bdag gi zhes rlom sems su mi byed /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid bdag gi zhes rlom sems su mi byed /
translated: they do not falsely project ‘the knowledge of all aspects is mine’;

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la rlom sems su mi byed /🔽rmi lam rlom sems su mi byed /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la rlom sems su mi byed / rmi lam rlom sems su mi byed /
translated: They do not falsely project omniscience.🔽They do not falsely project dreams.

original: rmi lam gyis rlom sems su mi byed /
analyzed: rmi lam gyis rlom sems su mi byed /
translated: They do not falsely project through dreams.

original: rmi lam bdag gi zhes rlom sems su mi byed /
analyzed: rmi lam bdag gi zhes rlom sems su mi byed /
translated: They do not falsely project ‘dreams are mine.’

original: rmi lam la rlom sems su mi byed /🔽sprul ba'i bar du rlom sems su mi byed /
analyzed: rmi lam la rlom sems su mi byed / sprul ba'i bar du rlom sems su mi byed /
translated: They do not falsely project dreams.🔽They do not falsely project up to emanations.

original: sprul pas rlom sems su mi byed /
analyzed: sprul pas rlom sems su mi byed /
translated: They do not falsely project through emanations.

original: sprul pa bdag gi zhes rlom sems su mi byed /
analyzed: sprul pa bdag gi zhes rlom sems su mi byed /
translated: They do not falsely project ‘emanations are mine.’

original: sprul pa la rlom sems su mi byed do //
analyzed: sprul pa la rlom sems su mi byed do //
translated: They do not falsely project emanations.

original: zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba'i mnyam pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba'i mnyam pa nyid yin no //
translated: This is the sameness of application.

original: de nas sangs rgyas kyi mthus stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di na rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lha rnams dang / sum cu rtsa gsum pa rnams dang / 'thab bral ba rnams dang / dga' ldan pa rnams dang / 'phrul dga' ba rnams dang /
analyzed: de nas sangs rgyas kyi mthus stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di na rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lha rnams dang / sum cu rtsa gsum pa rnams dang / 'thab bral ba rnams dang / dga' ldan pa rnams dang / 'phrul dga' ba rnams dang /
translated: Then, through the Buddha’s power, the gods of the Catur­mahā­rāja­kāyika realm, the gods of the Trayas­triṃśa realm, the gods of the Yāma realm, the gods of the Tuṣita realm, the gods of the Nirmāṇa­rata realm, and the gods of the Para­nirmita­vaśa­vartin realm in this world system of a billion worlds all came to where the Blessed One was, bowed their heads to the Blessed One’s feet, and sat to one side.

original: gzhan 'phrul dbang byed pa rnams dang / tshangs 'khor ba rnams dang / tshangs pa'i mdun na 'don pa rnams dang / tshangs pa chen po rnams dang / gnas gtsang ma'i ris kyi bar gyi lha'i bu gang ji snyed cig yod pa de thams cad lha rdzas kyi tsan dan gyi phye mas bcom ldan 'das la mngon par 'thor zhing bcom ldan 'das gang na ba der dong ste lhags nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs gnyis
analyzed: gzhan 'phrul dbang byed pa rnams dang / tshangs 'khor ba rnams dang / tshangs pa'i mdun na 'don pa rnams dang / tshangs pa chen po rnams dang / gnas gtsang ma'i ris kyi bar gyi lha'i bu gang ji snyed cig yod pa de thams cad lha rdzas kyi tsan dan gyi phye mas bcom ldan 'das la mngon par 'thor zhing bcom ldan 'das gang na ba der dong ste lhags nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs gnyis
translated: the gods of the Heaven of Making Use of Others’ Emanations, the gods of the Heaven of the Four Great Kings, the gods of the Heaven of the Thirty-Three, the gods of the Heaven Free from Strife, the gods of the Heaven of Joy, the gods of the Heaven of Delighting in Emanations, the gods of the Heaven of Making Use of Others’ Emanations, the gods of the Brahma Heavens, the gods of the Heaven of Brahmā’s Ministers, the gods of the Heaven of Brahmā’s Retinue, the gods of the Heaven of Great Brahmā, and the gods of the Pure Abodes, all of them scattered divine sandalwood powder over the Blessed One.

original: la spyi bos phyag 'tshal te /
analyzed: la spyi bos phyag 'tshal te /
translated: They then approached the Blessed One and, having arrived,🔽they bowed their heads to the Blessed One’s two feet

original: phyogs gcig tu 'khod do //
analyzed: phyogs gcig tu 'khod do //
translated: and sat to one side.

original: de nas rgyal po chen po bzhi dang / brgya byin dang / tshangs pa dang / gnas gtsang ma'i ris kyi bar gyi lha'i bu rnams kyis sangs rgyas kyi mthus /
analyzed: de nas rgyal po chen po bzhi dang / brgya byin dang / tshangs pa dang / gnas gtsang ma'i ris kyi bar gyi lha'i bu rnams kyis sangs rgyas kyi mthus /
translated: Then, by the power of the Buddha,

original: sangs rgyas stong yi ge 'di @161b nyid dang / ming 'di nyid dang / rab 'byor zhes bya ba'i dge slong kho nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid yongs su zhu ba byas shing ston par byed pa dang / lha rnams kyi dbang po brgya byin shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid yongs su zhu bar byed cing chos ston par mdzad pa sems kyis mthong bar gyur to //
analyzed: sangs rgyas stong yi ge 'di @161b nyid dang / ming 'di nyid dang / rab 'byor zhes bya ba'i dge slong kho nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid yongs su zhu ba byas shing ston par byed pa dang / lha rnams kyi dbang po brgya byin shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid yongs su zhu bar byed cing chos ston par mdzad pa sems kyis mthong bar gyur to //
translated: He saw a thousand buddhas, with this very name, this very name, and only the monk Subhūti asking this very perfection of wisdom, teaching it, and Śakra, Lord of the Gods, asking this very perfection of wisdom and teaching the Dharma.🔽In the same way, in the east, south, west, north, above, and below, in all the directions, he saw a thousand buddhas, with this very name, this very name, and only the monk Subhūti asking this very perfection of wisdom, teaching it,

original: de bzhin du shar phyogs dang / lho dang / nub dang / byang dang / steng dang / 'og gi phyogs rnams dang / mtshams rnams thams cad na sangs rgyas stong yi ge 'di nyid dang / ming 'di nyid dang / rab 'byor zhes bya ba'i dge slong kho nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid zhu ba byas shing ston par byed pa dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du shar phyogs dang / lho dang / nub dang / byang dang / steng dang / 'og gi phyogs rnams dang / mtshams rnams thams cad na sangs rgyas stong yi ge 'di nyid dang / ming 'di nyid dang / rab 'byor zhes bya ba'i dge slong kho nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid zhu ba byas shing ston par byed pa dang /
translated: and Śakra, Lord of the Gods, asking this very perfection of wisdom and teaching the Dharma.

original: thams cad du lha rnams kyi dbang po brgya byin shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid zhu bar byed cing chos ston par mdzad pa rnams sems kyis mthong bar gyur to //
analyzed: thams cad du lha rnams kyi dbang po brgya byin shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid zhu bar byed cing chos ston par mdzad pa rnams sems kyis mthong bar gyur to //
translated: Everywhere he saw Śakra, Lord of the Gods, asking questions about this very perfection of wisdom and teaching the Dharma.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: Then the Lord said to the venerable Subhūti:

original: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byams pa yang sa'i phyogs 'di nyid du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas te /
analyzed: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byams pa yang sa'i phyogs 'di nyid du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas te /
translated: “Subhūti, the bodhisattva great being Maitreya, too, will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening in this very place,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: and he will teach this very perfection of wisdom.”

original: gang yang bskal pa bzang po 'di la de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gang 'byung ba de dag kyang sa'i phyogs 'di nyid du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas
analyzed: gang yang bskal pa bzang po 'di la de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gang 'byung ba de dag kyang sa'i phyogs 'di nyid du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas
translated: And those Tathāgatas, Arhats, Perfectly Awakened Ones who will appear in this fortunate eon, they too will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening in this very place,

original: te / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid 'chad par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i lam gyi skad cig ma bcu drug po dbang du gyur par shes par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: te / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid 'chad par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i lam gyi skad cig ma bcu drug po dbang du gyur par shes par byed pa yin no //
translated: and they will teach this very perfection of wisdom.” This is the knowledge of mastery over the sixteen moments of the path of seeing.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the venerable Subhūti said to the Lord:🔽“Lord, this perfection of wisdom is profound.

original: bcom ldan 'das rnam pa gang dag dang / rtags gang dag dang / mtshan ma gang dag gis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byams pa bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid 'chad par 'gyur /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rnam pa gang dag dang / rtags gang dag dang / mtshan ma gang dag gis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byams pa bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid 'chad par 'gyur /
translated: “Blessed One, by what aspects, what marks, and what signs will the bodhisattva great being Maitreya, having fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, teach this very perfection of wisdom?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied,

original: rab 'byor 'dir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byams @162a * //
analyzed: rab 'byor 'dir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byams @162a * //
translated: “Subhūti, here the bodhisattva great being Maitreya,

original: pa bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas gzugs rtag ces bya ba'am mi rtag ces bya bar chos ston par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: pa bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas gzugs rtag ces bya ba'am mi rtag ces bya bar chos ston par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: having fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, will not teach the Dharma saying ‘form is permanent’ or ‘form is impermanent.’

original: de bzhin du bde zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: de bzhin du bde zhes bya ba'am /
translated: Similarly, he will not teach the Dharma saying ‘it is happiness’

original: sdug bsngal zhes bya ba'am /🔽bdag ces bya ba'am /
analyzed: sdug bsngal zhes bya ba'am / bdag ces bya ba'am /
translated: or ‘it is suffering,’🔽‘it has a self’

original: bdag med ces bya ba'am /
analyzed: bdag med ces bya ba'am /
translated: or ‘it is without a self,’🔽‘it is attractive’

original: sdug ces bya ba'am /
analyzed: sdug ces bya ba'am /
translated: or ‘it is unattractive.’

original: mi sdug ces bya bar chos ston par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi sdug ces bya bar chos ston par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: He will not teach the Dharma saying, ‘Form is attractive’ or ‘Form is unattractive.’

original: gzugs bcings zhes bya ba'am grol zhes bya bar chos ston par mi 'gyur ro //🔽de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa rtag ces bya ba'am /🔽mi rtag ces bya bar chos ston par mi 'gyur ro //🔽de bzhin du bde zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: gzugs bcings zhes bya ba'am grol zhes bya bar chos ston par mi 'gyur ro // de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa rtag ces bya ba'am / mi rtag ces bya bar chos ston par mi 'gyur ro // de bzhin du bde zhes bya ba'am /
translated: He will not teach the Dharma saying, ‘Form is bound’ or ‘Form is liberated.’🔽Similarly, he will not teach the Dharma saying, ‘Feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are permanent’ or ‘Feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are impermanent.’

original: sdug bsngal zhes bya ba'am /🔽bdag ces bya ba'am /🔽bdag med ces bya ba'am /
analyzed: sdug bsngal zhes bya ba'am / bdag ces bya ba'am / bdag med ces bya ba'am /
translated: He will not teach the Dharma saying, ‘Feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are happiness’ or ‘Feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are suffering.’

original: sdug ces bya ba'am mi sdug ces bya bar chos ston par mi 'gyur ro //🔽rnam par shes pa bcings zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: sdug ces bya ba'am mi sdug ces bya bar chos ston par mi 'gyur ro // rnam par shes pa bcings zhes bya ba'am /
translated: He will not teach the Dharma saying, ‘Feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are a self’ or ‘Feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are not a self.’🔽He will not teach the Dharma saying, ‘Feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are attractive’ or ‘Feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are unattractive.’

original: grol zhes bya bar chos ston par mi 'gyur ro //🔽gzugs 'das zhes bya ba'am /🔽ma 'ongs pa zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: grol zhes bya bar chos ston par mi 'gyur ro // gzugs 'das zhes bya ba'am / ma 'ongs pa zhes bya ba'am /
translated: He will not teach the Dharma saying, ‘Consciousness is bound’ or ‘Consciousness is liberated.’

original: da ltar byung ba zhes bya bar chos ston par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: da ltar byung ba zhes bya bar chos ston par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: He will not teach the Dharma saying, ‘Form is past’ or ‘Form is future’ or ‘Form is present.’🔽He will not teach the Dharma saying, ‘Feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are past’ or ‘Feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are future’ or ‘Feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are present.’

original: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa 'das pa zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa 'das pa zhes bya ba'am /
translated: In the same way, he would not teach the Dharma by saying, ‘Feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are past,🔽or future,

original: ma 'ongs pa zhes bya ba'am /🔽da ltar byung ba zhes bya bar chos ston par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa zhes bya ba'am / da ltar byung ba zhes bya bar chos ston par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: or present.’

original: de bzhin du so so ba dang / bsdus pa'i phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba rnams dang / pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / ting nge 'dzin thams cad dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du so so ba dang / bsdus pa'i phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba rnams dang / pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / ting nge 'dzin thams cad dang /
translated: In the same way, he would not teach the Dharma by saying, ‘The individual and composite aggregates, elements, sense fields, dependent origination, all the perfections, all the emptinesses, all the meditative stabilizations,

original: gzungs kyi sgo thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams dang / tshad med pa rnams dang / bsam gtan rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad rnams dang /
analyzed: gzungs kyi sgo thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams dang / tshad med pa rnams dang / bsam gtan rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad rnams dang /
translated: all the dhāraṇī gateways, the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening, the noble truths, the immeasurables, the concentrations, the formless absorptions, the eight deliverances,

original: mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu rnams dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa rnams dang / smon pa med pa rnams dang / mngon par shes pa rnams dang / stobs bcu rnams dang /
analyzed: mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu rnams dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa rnams dang / smon pa med pa rnams dang / mngon par shes pa rnams dang / stobs bcu rnams dang /
translated: the nine serial absorptions, emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness, the ten powers,

original: mi 'jigs pa rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams dang / rnam pa thams @162b cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du 'das pa zhes bya ba dang / ma 'ongs pa zhes bya ba dang /
