original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams kyi stong pa nyid kyis stong ngo //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams kyi stong pa nyid kyis stong ngo //
translated: The applications of mindfulness are empty of the applications of mindfulness.

original: de bzhin du yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / lam rnams lam rnams kyi stong pa nyid kyis stong ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / lam rnams lam rnams kyi stong pa nyid kyis stong ngo //
translated: Likewise, the right efforts, the legs of miraculous power, the faculties, the powers, the branches of enlightenment, and the path are empty of the path.

original: tshad med pa dang / bsam @168b gtan dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams tshad med pa dang / bsam gtan dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams kyi stong pa nyid kyis stong ngo //
analyzed: tshad med pa dang / bsam @168b gtan dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams tshad med pa dang / bsam gtan dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams kyi stong pa nyid kyis stong ngo //
translated: The immeasurables, the concentrations, and the formless absorptions are empty of the immeasurables, the concentrations, and the formless absorptions.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams kyi stong pa nyid kyis stong ngo //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams kyi stong pa nyid kyis stong ngo //
translated: The noble truths are empty of the noble truths.

original: rnam par thar pa brgyad rnams rnam par thar pa brgyad kyi stong pa nyid kyis stong ngo //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa brgyad rnams rnam par thar pa brgyad kyi stong pa nyid kyis stong ngo //
translated: The eight liberations are empty of the eight liberations.

original: mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu rnams mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu rnams kyi stong pa nyid kyis stong ngo //
analyzed: mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu rnams mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu rnams kyi stong pa nyid kyis stong ngo //
translated: The nine serial absorptions are empty of the nine serial absorptions.

original: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa rnams stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i stong pa nyid kyis stong ngo //
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa rnams stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i stong pa nyid kyis stong ngo //
translated: emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness are empty of emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness.

original: mngon par shes pa rnams mngon par shes pa rnams kyi stong pa nyid kyis stong ngo //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa rnams mngon par shes pa rnams kyi stong pa nyid kyis stong ngo //
translated: The clairvoyances are empty of the clairvoyances.

original: ting nge 'dzin thams cad ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi stong pa nyid kyis stong ngo //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin thams cad ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi stong pa nyid kyis stong ngo //
translated: All the meditative stabilizations are empty of all the meditative stabilizations.

original: gzungs kyi sgo rnams gzungs kyi sgo rnams kyi stong pa nyid kyis stong ngo //
analyzed: gzungs kyi sgo rnams gzungs kyi sgo rnams kyi stong pa nyid kyis stong ngo //
translated: The dhāraṇī gateways are empty of the dhāraṇī gateways.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs rnams kyi stong pa nyid kyis stong ngo //🔽mi 'jigs pa bzhi rnams mi 'jigs pa bzhi rnams kyi stong pa nyid kyis stong ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs rnams kyi stong pa nyid kyis stong ngo // mi 'jigs pa bzhi rnams mi 'jigs pa bzhi rnams kyi stong pa nyid kyis stong ngo //
translated: The ten powers of the tathāgatas are empty of the ten powers of the tathāgatas.🔽The four fearlessnesses are empty of the four fearlessnesses.

original: so so yang dag par rig pa rnams so so yang dag par rig pa rnams kyi stong pa nyid kyis stong ngo //
analyzed: so so yang dag par rig pa rnams so so yang dag par rig pa rnams kyi stong pa nyid kyis stong ngo //
translated: The four detailed and thorough knowledges are empty of the four detailed and thorough knowledges.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad rnams sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad rnams kyi stong ba nyid kyis stong ngo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad rnams sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad rnams kyi stong ba nyid kyis stong ngo //
translated: the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha are empty of the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha,

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'i stong pa nyid kyis stong ngo //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'i stong pa nyid kyis stong ngo //
translated: the result of stream enterer is empty of the result of stream enterer,

original: de bzhin du lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang ; dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang byang chub dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi stong pa nyid kyis stong ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang ; dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang byang chub dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi stong pa nyid kyis stong ngo //
translated: and similarly, the result of once-returner, the result of non-returner, the state of a worthy one, a pratyekabuddha’s awakening, and the knowledge of all aspects is empty of the knowledge of all aspects.”

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /🔽bcom ldan 'das 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das 'di lta ste /
translated: Subhūti then said,🔽“Lord, this perfection of wisdom

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni pha rol tu phyin pa chen mo'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni pha rol tu phyin pa chen mo'o //
translated: is a great perfection.

original: chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin yang chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin gyis stong la /
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin yang chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin gyis stong la /
translated: The intrinsic nature of all phenomena is empty of the intrinsic nature of all phenomena,🔽and

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya yang chos gang yong mngon par rdzogs par @169a * //🔽'tshang rgya ba ma mchis /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya yang chos gang yong mngon par rdzogs par @169a * // 'tshang rgya ba ma mchis /
translated: and the bodhisattva great beings, standing in the perfection of wisdom, fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, but there is no dharma that they fully awaken to;

original: chos kyi 'khor lo yang bskor la chos gang yang bskor ba'am mi bskor ba yang ma mchis te /
analyzed: chos kyi 'khor lo yang bskor la chos gang yang bskor ba'am mi bskor ba yang ma mchis te /
translated: they turn the wheel of the Dharma, but there is no dharma that is turned or not turned;

original: de dag gis chos gang yang yongs su mthong ba yang ma mchis yongs su mi mthong ba yang ma mchis so //
analyzed: de dag gis chos gang yang yongs su mthong ba yang ma mchis yongs su mi mthong ba yang ma mchis so //
translated: they do not see any dharma at all, and they do not not see any dharma at all.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /🔽de ni 'di ltar gang bskor bar bgyi ba'am /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na / de ni 'di ltar gang bskor bar bgyi ba'am /
translated: Why is that?

original: mi bskor bar bgyi ba'i chos thams cad dmigs su ma mchis pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi bskor bar bgyi ba'i chos thams cad dmigs su ma mchis pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is because all dharmas that are to be turned or not to be turned are not apprehended.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de ni 'di ltar chos thams cad shin tu mngon par ma grub pa ste /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar chos thams cad shin tu mngon par ma grub pa ste /
translated: It is because all dharmas are utterly unproduced.

original: stong pa nyid bskor bar bgyi ba'am mi bskor bar bgyi ba ma lags /🔽mtshan ma ma mchis pa bskor bar bgyi ba'am /
analyzed: stong pa nyid bskor bar bgyi ba'am mi bskor bar bgyi ba ma lags / mtshan ma ma mchis pa bskor bar bgyi ba'am /
translated: It is not that emptiness should be made to revolve or not made to revolve.

original: mi bskor bar bgyi ba ma lags so //🔽smon pa ma mchis pa bskor bar bgyi ba'am /
analyzed: mi bskor bar bgyi ba ma lags so // smon pa ma mchis pa bskor bar bgyi ba'am /
translated: It is not that the signless should be made to revolve or not made to revolve.

original: mi bskor bar bgyi ba ma lags so //
analyzed: mi bskor bar bgyi ba ma lags so //
translated: It is not that the wishless should be made to revolve or not made to revolve.🔽In that way, this teaching, illumination, expression, designation, arrangement, analysis,

original: de ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa dang / rab tu gsal bar byas pa dang / brjod pa dang / btags pa dang / rab tu bkod pa dang / rnam par dbye ba dang / rnam par dgrol ba dang /
analyzed: de ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa dang / rab tu gsal bar byas pa dang / brjod pa dang / btags pa dang / rab tu bkod pa dang / rnam par dbye ba dang / rnam par dgrol ba dang /
translated: unravelling,

original: mtshon pa dang / yang dag par rab tu gsal bar bgyid pa dang / yang dag par bstan pa 'di ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa yongs su dag pa'o //
analyzed: mtshon pa dang / yang dag par rab tu gsal bar bgyid pa dang / yang dag par bstan pa 'di ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa yongs su dag pa'o //
translated: illustration, perfect illumination, and demonstration of the perfection of wisdom is the pure teaching of the perfection of wisdom.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa de yang sus kyang ma bstan /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa de yang sus kyang ma bstan /
translated: Moreover, that teaching of the perfection of wisdom is not taught by anyone,

original: sus kyang ma bzung /
analyzed: sus kyang ma bzung /
translated: and is not grasped by anyone.

original: gang sus kyang ma bzung ba de ni sus kyang mngon du ma bgyis so //
analyzed: gang sus kyang ma bzung ba de ni sus kyang mngon du ma bgyis so //
translated: That which is not grasped by anyone is not realized by anyone.

original: gang sus kyang mngon du ma bgyis pa de la ni yangs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ma mchis te /
analyzed: gang sus kyang mngon du ma bgyis pa de la ni yangs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ma mchis te /
translated: That which is not realized by anyone does not have complete nirvana.

original: chos bstan pa 'di la ni gang sus kyang sbyin pa'i gnas su gyur pa ma mchis so zhes bya ba ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi dbang du byas pa yongs su rdzogs par bstan pa ste gsum pa'o //
analyzed: chos bstan pa 'di la ni gang sus kyang sbyin pa'i gnas su gyur pa ma mchis so zhes bya ba ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi dbang du byas pa yongs su rdzogs par bstan pa ste gsum pa'o //
translated: In this teaching of the Dharma, there is no one who has become an object of generosity.” This is the third chapter that explains the perfection of omniscience.

original: 'di dag gis ni thams cad shes pa nyid gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di dag gis ni thams cad shes pa nyid gsungs so //
translated: By these, the knowledge of all things is taught.

original: 'phags pa bcom ldan 'das ma shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag nyi shu lnga pa mngon par rtogs pa'i rgyan gyi rjes su 'brangs nas dag par gtugs pa las thams cad shes pas dbang du byas ba spyod pa'i khyad par gyi le'u ste gsum
analyzed: 'phags pa bcom ldan 'das ma shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag nyi shu lnga pa mngon par rtogs pa'i rgyan gyi rjes su 'brangs nas dag par gtugs pa las thams cad shes pas dbang du byas ba spyod pa'i khyad par gyi le'u ste gsum
translated: Noble One, following the Ornament of Clear Realization of the Blessed Lady Perfection of Wisdom in Twenty-five Thousand Lines, in the section on purification, this is the third chapter on the distinctive conduct from the perspective of the knowledge of all things.

original: pa'o / // / de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: pa'o / // / de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //

original: bcom ldan 'das 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'di lta ste /
translated: The Lord: Because of the nonstopping of all dharmas.🔽Subhuti: This perfection of wisdom is a perfection of nondefilement.🔽The Lord: Because of the nondefilement of all dharmas.

analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni ma mchis pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //

original: chos thams cad las yang dag par 'das pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: chos thams cad las yang dag par 'das pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because of the complete passing away of all dharmas.

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /🔽bcom ldan 'das 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das 'di lta ste /
translated: Subhuti:

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni de bzhin nyid kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni de bzhin nyid kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: This perfection of wisdom is the perfection of Suchness.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord:🔽Because of the complete passing away of all dharmas.

original: sangs rgyas thams cad kyis gsungs pa'i de bzhin nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad kyis gsungs pa'i de bzhin nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the suchness taught by all the Buddhas.

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /🔽bcom ldan 'das 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das 'di lta ste /
translated: Subhūti said,🔽Blessed One, this perfection of wisdom

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni rang byung gi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //🔽bcom ldan @175a * //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni rang byung gi pha rol tu phyin pa'o // bcom ldan @175a * //
translated: is the self-originated perfection.🔽Blessed One,

original: 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: the Blessed One said,

original: chos thams cad la dbang sgyur ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: chos thams cad la dbang sgyur ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because it is the mastery of all phenomena.

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /🔽bcom ldan 'das 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das 'di lta ste /
translated: Subhūti said,🔽Blessed One, this perfection of wisdom

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni sangs rgyas kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni sangs rgyas kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: is the perfection of the Buddhas.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,🔽because it fully and completely awakens to all phenomena in all their aspects.

original: chos thams cad rnam pa thams cad du mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la brten pa'i rnam pa yin te /
analyzed: chos thams cad rnam pa thams cad du mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la brten pa'i rnam pa yin te /
translated: This is the aspect based on the knowledge of all aspects.

original: 'di dag gis ni rnam pa gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di dag gis ni rnam pa gsungs so //
translated: These explain the aspects.

original: de nas lha rnams kyi dbang po brgya byin 'di snyam du gyur te /🔽shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: de nas lha rnams kyi dbang po brgya byin 'di snyam du gyur te / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: Then Śakra, Lord of the Gods, thought this:🔽“Those sons of a good family or daughters of a good family

original: rigs kyi bu mo gang dag gi rna lam du grag par gyur pa de dag kyang sngon gyi rgyal ba la bsnyen bkur byas pa'o //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo gang dag gi rna lam du grag par gyur pa de dag kyang sngon gyi rgyal ba la bsnyen bkur byas pa'o //
translated: who have heard this perfection of wisdom have served the Victors of the past.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di sems can gang dag gi rna lam du grag par gyur pa de dag kyang de bzhin gshegs pa la dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di sems can gang dag gi rna lam du grag par gyur pa de dag kyang de bzhin gshegs pa la dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa'o //
translated: Those sentient beings who have heard this perfection of wisdom have planted wholesome roots with the Tathāgata.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di sems can gang dag gi rna lam du grag par gyur pa de dag kyang dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su bzung ba yin na /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di sems can gang dag gi rna lam du grag par gyur pa de dag kyang dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su bzung ba yin na /
translated: Those sentient beings who have heard this perfection of wisdom have been taken hold of by a spiritual friend.

original: gang 'dzin par 'gyur /
analyzed: gang 'dzin par 'gyur /
translated: Those who will take it up,

original: 'chang bar 'gyur /
analyzed: 'chang bar 'gyur /
translated: bear it in mind,

original: klog par 'gyur /
analyzed: klog par 'gyur /
translated: read it aloud,

original: tshul bzhin du yid la byed par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: tshul bzhin du yid la byed par 'gyur zhing /
translated: and properly pay attention to it,🔽and who will take it up, bear it in mind,

original: bzung / bcangs /
analyzed: bzung / bcangs /
translated: and recite it,

original: klags / kun chub par byas nas de kho na nyid du bsgrub par 'gyur ba lta ci zhig smos te /
analyzed: klags / kun chub par byas nas de kho na nyid du bsgrub par 'gyur ba lta ci zhig smos te /
translated: and cultivate it in the right way?

original: rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di thos nas 'dzin par 'gyur /🔽'chang bar 'gyur /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di thos nas 'dzin par 'gyur / 'chang bar 'gyur /
translated: “Those sons or daughters of good family who, having heard this perfection of wisdom, will take it up,🔽bear it in mind,

original: klog par 'gyur /🔽kun chub par byed par 'gyur /
analyzed: klog par 'gyur / kun chub par byed par 'gyur /
translated: recite it, master it,

original: tshul bzhin du yid la byed par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: tshul bzhin du yid la byed par 'gyur zhing /
translated: and cultivate it in the right way,

original: bzung ; bcangs /
analyzed: bzung ; bcangs /
translated: and having taken it up, borne it in mind,

original: klags / kun chub par byas nas kyang de kho na nyid du sgrub par byed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: klags / kun chub par byas nas kyang de kho na nyid du sgrub par byed par 'gyur te /
translated: recited it, mastered it, and cultivated it in the right way, would practice it in accordance with the true nature,

original: de dag ni sangs rgyas mang po la bsnyen bkur byas pa'o //
analyzed: de dag ni sangs rgyas mang po la bsnyen bkur byas pa'o //
translated: they have attended on many buddhas.

original: rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di thos nas dngang bar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di thos nas dngang bar mi 'gyur /
translated: Those sons or daughters of good family who, having heard this perfection of wisdom, will not be afraid,🔽will not be fearful,

original: kun tu skrag par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: kun tu skrag par mi 'gyur /
translated: and will not be terrified,

original: kun tu skrag pas zin par mi 'gyur ba de dag ni sngon gyi de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams la yongs su dris /
analyzed: kun tu skrag pas zin par mi 'gyur ba de dag ni sngon gyi de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams la yongs su dris /
translated: They have asked the former Tathāgatas, Arhats, Perfectly Awakened Ones,

original: yongs su zhus /
analyzed: yongs su zhus /
translated: they have questioned them,

original: brten cing bsnyen bkur ba'o //
analyzed: brten cing bsnyen bkur ba'o //
translated: they have attended on them,

original: gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di thos nas dngang bar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di thos nas dngang bar mi 'gyur /
translated: Those who, having heard this perfection of wisdom, will not tremble,

original: kun tu skrag par mi 'gyur /🔽@175b kun tu skrag pas zin par mi 'gyur ba de dag ni sangs rgyas bye ba mang po las sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
analyzed: kun tu skrag par mi 'gyur / @175b kun tu skrag pas zin par mi 'gyur ba de dag ni sangs rgyas bye ba mang po las sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
translated: will not be frightened or terrified,🔽they have practiced the perfection of giving, the perfection of morality, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance,

original: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad pa'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad pa'o //
translated: and the perfection of concentration under many hundreds of thousands of Buddhas.

original: de dag ni sangs rgyas bye ba mang po las shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad pa'o snyam pa dang / de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de dag ni sangs rgyas bye ba mang po las shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad pa'o snyam pa dang / de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then venerable Śāriputra said to the Lord:

original: bcom ldan 'das rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: “Lord, those sons of a good family or

original: rigs kyi bu mo gang 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ltar zab pa 'di thos nas dngang bar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo gang 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ltar zab pa 'di thos nas dngang bar mi 'gyur /
translated: those daughters of a good family who, having heard this deep perfection of wisdom, will not be cowed,

original: kun tu skrag par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: kun tu skrag par mi 'gyur /
translated: will not be frightened,

original: kun tu skrag pas zin par mi 'gyur zhing thos nas kyang 'dzin par 'gyur /
analyzed: kun tu skrag pas zin par mi 'gyur zhing thos nas kyang 'dzin par 'gyur /
translated: will not be terrified, and having heard it will take it up,

original: 'chang bar 'gyur /🔽klog par 'gyur /
analyzed: 'chang bar 'gyur / klog par 'gyur /
translated: will bear it in mind,🔽will recite it,

original: kun chub par byed par 'gyur /
analyzed: kun chub par byed par 'gyur /
translated: will master it,

original: tshul bzhin du yid la byed par 'gyur ba'i rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: tshul bzhin du yid la byed par 'gyur ba'i rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: and will properly pay attention to it, those sons of a good family or

original: rigs kyi bu mo de dag ni phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ji lta ba de bzhin du gzung bar bgyi'o //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo de dag ni phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ji lta ba de bzhin du gzung bar bgyi'o //
translated: those daughters of a good family should be regarded as irreversible bodhisattva great beings.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is it so?”

original: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni zab pa'i slad du ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni zab pa'i slad du ste /
translated: “Blessed One, this perfection of wisdom is profound.

original: sngon pha rol tu phyin pa drug rnams la ma spyad pas ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la mos par nus pa ma lags so //
analyzed: sngon pha rol tu phyin pa drug rnams la ma spyad pas ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la mos par nus pa ma lags so //
translated: Those who have not trained in the six perfections in the past will not be able to believe in this profound perfection of wisdom.

original: bcom ldan 'das rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: Blessed One, those sons of enlightened heritage or

original: rigs kyi bu mo gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di thos nas spang bar bya bar sems pa'i rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di thos nas spang bar bya bar sems pa'i rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: daughters of enlightened heritage who, on hearing this profound perfection of wisdom, think that it should be rejected,

original: rigs kyi bu mo de dag gis ni sngon gyi mthar yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di spangs par gyur to //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo de dag gis ni sngon gyi mthar yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di spangs par gyur to //
translated: those sons of enlightened heritage or daughters of enlightened heritage have rejected this profound perfection of wisdom in the past as well.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de ni 'di ltar rigs kyi bu'am /🔽rigs kyi bu mo gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'dir dad pa ma mchis /🔽rab tu dang ba ma mchis /🔽dga' ba ma mchis /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar rigs kyi bu'am / rigs kyi bu mo gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'dir dad pa ma mchis / rab tu dang ba ma mchis / dga' ba ma mchis /
translated: It is because those sons of enlightened heritage or

original: mos pa ma mchis pa'i slad du ste /
analyzed: mos pa ma mchis pa'i slad du ste /
translated: daughters of enlightened heritage do not have faith in, do not have confidence in, do not have joy in, and do not have devotion to this profound perfection of wisdom.

original: rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo de dag gis sangs rgyas rnams sam /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo de dag gis sangs rgyas rnams sam /
translated: “Son of noble family or daughter of noble family, how should they practice the perfection of generosity with regard to the buddhas,

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams sam /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams sam /
translated: the bodhisattvas,

original: rang sangs rgyas rnams sam /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas rnams sam /
translated: the pratyekabuddhas,

original: nyan thos rnams la ji ltar sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bgyi /
analyzed: nyan thos rnams la ji ltar sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bgyi /
translated: and the śrāvakas?

original: ji ltar tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bgyi /
analyzed: ji ltar tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bgyi /
translated: How should they practice the perfection of moral discipline?

original: ji ltar bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bgyi /🔽ji ltar brtson @176a * //
analyzed: ji ltar bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bgyi / ji ltar brtson @176a * //
translated: How should they practice the perfection of patience?

original: 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod par bgyi /
analyzed: 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod par bgyi /
translated: How should they practice the perfection of diligence?

original: ji ltar bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bgyi /
analyzed: ji ltar bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bgyi /
translated: How should they practice the perfection of concentration?

original: ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bgyi /🔽ji ltar nang stong pa nyid la spyad par bgyi /🔽ji ltar phyi stong pa nyid la spyad par bgyi /
analyzed: ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bgyi / ji ltar nang stong pa nyid la spyad par bgyi / ji ltar phyi stong pa nyid la spyad par bgyi /
translated: How should they practice the perfection of wisdom?🔽How should they practice inner emptiness?🔽How should they practice outer emptiness?

original: ji ltar phyi nang stong pa nyid la spyad par bgyi /
analyzed: ji ltar phyi nang stong pa nyid la spyad par bgyi /
translated: How should they practice inner and outer emptiness?

original: ji ltar dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar la spyad par bgyi /
analyzed: ji ltar dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar la spyad par bgyi /
translated: How should they practice up to the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature?

original: ji ltar dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams bsgom par bgyi /
analyzed: ji ltar dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams bsgom par bgyi /
translated: How should they cultivate the applications of mindfulness?

original: ji ltar yang dag par spong ba rnams dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams dang / dbang po rnams dang / stobs rnams dang / ji ltar byang chub kyi yan lag rnams dang / ji ltar 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa rnams bsgom par bgyi /
analyzed: ji ltar yang dag par spong ba rnams dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams dang / dbang po rnams dang / stobs rnams dang / ji ltar byang chub kyi yan lag rnams dang / ji ltar 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa rnams bsgom par bgyi /
translated: How should they cultivate the right efforts, legs of miraculous power, faculties, powers, limbs of awakening, and the eightfold noble path?

original: ji ltar tshad med pa dang / bsam gtan dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams bsgom par bgyi /
analyzed: ji ltar tshad med pa dang / bsam gtan dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams bsgom par bgyi /
translated: How should they cultivate the immeasurables, concentrations, and formless absorptions?

original: ji ltar 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams bsgom par bgyi /
analyzed: ji ltar 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams bsgom par bgyi /
translated: How should they cultivate the noble truths?

original: ji ltar rnam par thar pa brgyad rnams bsgom par bgyi /
analyzed: ji ltar rnam par thar pa brgyad rnams bsgom par bgyi /
translated: How should they cultivate the eight deliverances?

original: ji ltar mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu rnams bsgom par bgyi /
analyzed: ji ltar mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu rnams bsgom par bgyi /
translated: How should they cultivate the nine serial absorptions?

original: ji ltar stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa rnams bsgom par bgyi /
analyzed: ji ltar stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa rnams bsgom par bgyi /
translated: How should one cultivate emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness?

original: ji ltar mngon par shes pa rnams bsgom par bgyi /
analyzed: ji ltar mngon par shes pa rnams bsgom par bgyi /
translated: How should one cultivate the superknowledges?

original: ji ltar ting nge 'dzin rnams la snyoms par 'jug par bgyi /
analyzed: ji ltar ting nge 'dzin rnams la snyoms par 'jug par bgyi /
translated: How should one enter the meditative absorptions?

original: ji ltar gzungs kyi sgo rnams la 'jug par bgyi /
analyzed: ji ltar gzungs kyi sgo rnams la 'jug par bgyi /
translated: How should one enter the dhāraṇī gateways?

original: ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs rnams bsgom par bgyi /
analyzed: ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs rnams bsgom par bgyi /
translated: How should one cultivate the powers of the tathāgatas?

original: ji ltar mi 'jigs pa rnams bsgom par bgyi /
analyzed: ji ltar mi 'jigs pa rnams bsgom par bgyi /
translated: How should one cultivate the fearlessnesses?

original: ji ltar so so yang dag par rig pa rnams bsgom par bgyi /
analyzed: ji ltar so so yang dag par rig pa rnams bsgom par bgyi /
translated: How should one cultivate the detailed and thorough knowledges?

original: ji ltar sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad bsgom par bgyi zhes yongs su ma dris so //
analyzed: ji ltar sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad bsgom par bgyi zhes yongs su ma dris so //
translated: How should one cultivate the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha?”

original: de nas lha rnams kyi dbang po brgya byin gyis tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de nas lha rnams kyi dbang po brgya byin gyis tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Then Śatakratu, head of the gods, said to the venerable Śāriputra,

original: btsun pa sh'a ri'i bu shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di de ltar zab pa yin na /
analyzed: btsun pa sh'a ri'i bu shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di de ltar zab pa yin na /
translated: “Venerable Śāriputra, if this perfection of wisdom is so deep,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang sngon gyi mthar yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la mos par ma gyur pa 'di bas ngo mtshar ba ci yod /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang sngon gyi mthar yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la mos par ma gyur pa 'di bas ngo mtshar ba ci yod /
translated: What is more amazing than that a bodhisattva great being who in the past did not believe in this deep perfection of wisdom should now believe in it?

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol @176b tu phyin pa la mos par ma gyur /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol @176b tu phyin pa la mos par ma gyur /
translated: They did not believe in the perfection of giving, the perfection of morality, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of concentration, or the perfection of wisdom.

original: nang stong pa nyid la mos par ma gyur /
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid la mos par ma gyur /
translated: They did not believe in inner emptiness,

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar la mos par ma gyur /
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar la mos par ma gyur /
translated: up to and did not believe in the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun rnams la mos par ma gyur /
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun rnams la mos par ma gyur /
translated: They did not believe in the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening.

original: tshad med pa dang / bsam gtan dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams la mos par ma gyur /
analyzed: tshad med pa dang / bsam gtan dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams la mos par ma gyur /
translated: They did not believe in the immeasurables, the concentrations, or the formless absorptions.

original: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa rnams la mos par ma gyur /
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa rnams la mos par ma gyur /
translated: They have no interest in emptiness, signlessness, or wishlessness.

original: rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu rnams la mos par ma gyur /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu rnams la mos par ma gyur /
translated: They have no interest in the eight liberations or the nine serial steps of meditative absorption.

original: mngon par shes pa rnams dang / ting nge 'dzin rnams dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu rnams dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad rnams la mos par ma gyur par spangs par gyur pa de dag las 'dir ngo mtshar che ba ci yod /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa rnams dang / ting nge 'dzin rnams dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu rnams dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad rnams la mos par ma gyur par spangs par gyur pa de dag las 'dir ngo mtshar che ba ci yod /
translated: They have no interest in the [five] kinds of supernormal knowledge, the [four] kinds of methodological literature, the [six] superknowledges, the [ten] powers of the tathāgatas, the [four] fearlessnesses, the [four] detailed and thorough knowledges, or the [eighteen] unique qualities of the buddhas. What is so amazing about that?

original: bcom ldan 'das ma shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ma shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the Blessed Mother, Perfection of Wisdom!

original: gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la phyag 'tshal bar byed pa de ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes la phyag 'tshal bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la phyag 'tshal bar byed pa de ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes la phyag 'tshal bar byed pa'o //
translated: Whoever pays homage to the perfection of wisdom pays homage to the knowledge of all modes.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis lha rnams kyi dbang po brgya byin la bka' stsal pa /🔽de de bzhin te /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis lha rnams kyi dbang po brgya byin la bka' stsal pa / de de bzhin te /
translated: Then the Lord said to Sakra, Chief of Gods:

original: koo shi ka de de bzhin no //
analyzed: koo shi ka de de bzhin no //
translated: So it is, Kausika, so it is.

original: gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la phyag 'tshal bar byed pa de ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes la phyag 'tshal bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la phyag 'tshal bar byed pa de ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes la phyag 'tshal bar byed pa'o //
translated: Whoever pays homage to the perfection of wisdom pays homage to the knowledge of all modes.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: koo shi ka 'di las byung ba ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: koo shi ka 'di las byung ba ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: From this has come forth the knowledge of all modes of the Buddhas, the Lords.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes las byung ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas rab tu brjod pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes las byung ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas rab tu brjod pa'o //
translated: From the knowledge of all modes has come forth the perfection of wisdom, which has been expounded.

original: koo shi ka thams cad shes pa nyid las 'da' bar 'dod pa'i rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: koo shi ka thams cad shes pa nyid las 'da' bar 'dod pa'i rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: “Kauśika, a son of a good family who wants to transcend the knowledge of all aspects🔽

original: rigs kyi bu mos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas par bya'o //
translated: “Kauśika, a son of a good family or a daughter of a good family who wants to go beyond the knowledge of all aspects should stand in the perfection of wisdom.

original: de bzhin du lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid la gnas par 'dod pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes bskyed par 'dod pa dang / bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad spang bar 'dod pa dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid la gnas par 'dod pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes bskyed par 'dod pa dang / bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad spang bar 'dod pa dang /
translated: Similarly, a son of a good family or a daughter of a good family who wants to stand in the knowledge of path aspects, who wants to generate the knowledge of a knower of all aspects, who wants to eliminate all the afflictions with their residual impressions,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par @177a * //🔽byang chub par 'dod pa dang / chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bar 'dod pa'i rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par @177a * // byang chub par 'dod pa dang / chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bar 'dod pa'i rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: who wants to fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening,

original: rigs kyi bu mos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas par bya'o //
translated: who wants to turn the wheel of the Dharma, should stand in the perfection of wisdom.”

original: de bzhin du rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la sems can rnams 'god par 'dod pa dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid la 'god par 'dod pa dang / rang byang chub la sems can 'god par 'dod pa dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la sems can rnams 'god par 'dod pa dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid la 'god par 'dod pa dang / rang byang chub la sems can 'god par 'dod pa dang /
translated: in the result of once-returner, in the result of non-returner, in the state of a worthy one, in a pratyekabuddha’s awakening,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la sems can rnams 'god par 'dod pa dang / dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdu bar 'dod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la sems can rnams 'god par 'dod pa dang / dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdu bar 'dod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la gnas par bya'o //
translated: in unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, and who want to gather a saṅgha of monks should stand in this perfection of wisdom.”🔽The Lord having said that, Śatakratu, head of the gods, said to the Lord,

original: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / lha rnams kyi dbang po brgya byin gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / lha rnams kyi dbang po brgya byin gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: “Subhūti,

original: bcom ldan 'das ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas par 'gyur ba lags /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas par 'gyur ba lags /
translated: “Blessed One, how do bodhisattva great beings abide in the perfection of wisdom?

original: ji ltar na sbyor bar 'gyur ba lags /
analyzed: ji ltar na sbyor bar 'gyur ba lags /
translated: How do they apply themselves?

original: de bzhin du ji ltar na bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas par 'gyur ba lags /
analyzed: de bzhin du ji ltar na bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas par 'gyur ba lags /
translated: Similarly, how do they abide in the perfection of concentration, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of patience, the perfection of morality, and the perfection of generosity?

original: ji ltar na brtson par bgyid pa lags /
analyzed: ji ltar na brtson par bgyid pa lags /
translated: How do they strive?

original: ji ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: ji ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: When they practice the perfection of wisdom,

original: nang stong pa nyid la brtson par bgyid pa lags /
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid la brtson par bgyid pa lags /
translated: how do they strive in inner emptiness?

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar la brtson par bgyid pa lags /
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar la brtson par bgyid pa lags /
translated: How do they strive in the emptiness of the essential nature of non-entities?

original: ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: How do bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun la brtson par bgyid pa lags /
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun la brtson par bgyid pa lags /
translated: strive in the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening?

original: de bzhin du tshad med pa dang / bsam gtan dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa rnams la brtson par bgyid pa lags /
analyzed: de bzhin du tshad med pa dang / bsam gtan dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa rnams la brtson par bgyid pa lags /
translated: Similarly, how do they strive in the immeasurables, the concentrations, the formless absorptions, emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness?

original: de bzhin du rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu rnams la brtson par bgyid pa lags /
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu rnams la brtson par bgyid pa lags /
translated: Similarly, how do they strive in the eight deliverances and the nine serial absorptions?

original: ji ltar na mngon par shes pa rnams la brtson par bgyid pa lags /
analyzed: ji ltar na mngon par shes pa rnams la brtson par bgyid pa lags /
translated: How do they strive in the clairvoyances?

original: de bzhin du @177b byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: de bzhin du @177b byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: Similarly, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom,

original: ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu rnams dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad rnams la brtson par bgyid pa lags /
analyzed: ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu rnams dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad rnams la brtson par bgyid pa lags /
translated: How do they make endeavours in the ten powers of the Tathāgata, the four grounds of self-confidence, the four analytical knowledges, and the eighteen special qualities of the Buddha?

original: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis lha rnams kyi dbang po brgya byin la bka' stsal pa /🔽koo shi ka khyod legs so legs so //
analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis lha rnams kyi dbang po brgya byin la bka' stsal pa / koo shi ka khyod legs so legs so //
translated: The Lord having said this, Śatakratu, head of the gods, said to him:🔽“It is excellent, excellent, Lord, that you have taught the perfection of wisdom in detail to the Bodhisattvas, the great beings.

original: gang yang khyod de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas la don 'di yongs su 'dri bar sems pa khyod legs so //
analyzed: gang yang khyod de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas la don 'di yongs su 'dri bar sems pa khyod legs so //
translated: It is excellent, excellent, Sugata, that you have taught the perfection of wisdom in detail to the Bodhisattvas, the great beings.

original: koo shi ka spobs pa 'di yang sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs las byung ngo //
analyzed: koo shi ka spobs pa 'di yang sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs las byung ngo //
translated: This eloquence, too, Kauśika, has come about through the Buddha’s might.”

original: koo shi ka de'i phyir legs par rab tu nyon la yid la zung shig dang / de ngas khyod la bshad par bya'o zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba po rnam pa bzhi yin no //
analyzed: koo shi ka de'i phyir legs par rab tu nyon la yid la zung shig dang / de ngas khyod la bshad par bya'o zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba po rnam pa bzhi yin no //
translated: I will explain this to you.”

original: koo shi ka 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: koo shi ka 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: Kauśika, here, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom,

original: gzugs la mi gnas te /
analyzed: gzugs la mi gnas te /
translated: they do not dwell on form.

original: gang gi tshe gzugs la mi gnas pa de'i tshe gzugs la rnal 'byor du byed pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe gzugs la mi gnas pa de'i tshe gzugs la rnal 'byor du byed pa yin no //
translated: When they do not dwell on form, then they practice yoga on form.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa la mi gnas te /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa la mi gnas te /
translated: They do not dwell on feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness.

original: gang gi tshe rnam par shes pa la mi gnas pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe rnam par shes pa la mi gnas pa de'i tshe /
translated: When they do not dwell on consciousness,

original: rnam par shes pa la rnal 'byor du byed pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa la rnal 'byor du byed pa yin no //
translated: then they practice yoga on consciousness.

original: mig la mi gnas /
analyzed: mig la mi gnas /
translated: They do not dwell on the eyes.

original: de bzhin du rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid la mi gnas pa de ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la rnal 'byor du byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid la mi gnas pa de ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la rnal 'byor du byed pa yin no //
translated: Likewise, he does not stand in the ear, nose, tongue, body, or mind. Thus he practices the perfection of wisdom.

original: gzugs la mi gnas pa de bzhin du sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya dang / chos la mi gnas pa de ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la rnal 'byor du byed pa yin no //
analyzed: gzugs la mi gnas pa de bzhin du sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya dang / chos la mi gnas pa de ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la rnal 'byor du byed pa yin no //
translated: He does not stand in form, sound, smell, taste, touch, or dharmas. Thus he practices the perfection of wisdom.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa la mi gnas /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa la mi gnas /
translated: He does not stand in the eye consciousness,

original: mig gi 'dus te reg pa la mi gnas /
analyzed: mig gi 'dus te reg pa la mi gnas /
translated: he does not stand in eye contact,

original: mig gi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba la mi gnas /
analyzed: mig gi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba la mi gnas /
translated: he does not stand in the feeling that arises from the condition of eye contact.

original: de bzhin du rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa la mi gnas /
analyzed: de bzhin du rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa la mi gnas /
translated: Likewise, he does not stand in the ear, nose, tongue, body, or mind consciousnesses,

original: yid kyi 'dus te reg pa la mi gnas /
analyzed: yid kyi 'dus te reg pa la mi gnas /
translated: he does not stand in mind contact,

original: yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba la mi gnas pa de ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la rnal 'byor du byed pa yin no //
analyzed: yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba la mi gnas pa de ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la rnal 'byor du byed pa yin no //
translated: They do not stand in the feeling that is conditioned by sensory contact that is mentally compounded. In that way they practice yoga in the perfection of wisdom.

original: sa'i khams la mi gnas /
analyzed: sa'i khams la mi gnas /
translated: They do not stand in the earth element.

original: de bzhin du @178a * //
analyzed: de bzhin du @178a * //
translated: Similarly,

original: chu'i khams dang / me'i khams dang / rlung gi khams dang / nam mkha'i khams dang / rnam par shes pa'i khams la mi gnas pa de ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la rnal 'byor du byed pa yin no //
analyzed: chu'i khams dang / me'i khams dang / rlung gi khams dang / nam mkha'i khams dang / rnam par shes pa'i khams la mi gnas pa de ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la rnal 'byor du byed pa yin no //
translated: they do not stand in the water element, the fire element, the wind element, the space element, or the consciousness element. In that way they practice yoga in the perfection of wisdom.

original: ma rig pa la mi gnas /
analyzed: ma rig pa la mi gnas /
translated: They do not stand in ignorance.

original: de bzhin du 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa dang / ming dang gzugs dang / skye mched drug dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba dang / sred pa dang / len pa dang / srid pa dang / skye ba dang / rga shi dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa dang / ming dang gzugs dang / skye mched drug dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba dang / sred pa dang / len pa dang / srid pa dang / skye ba dang / rga shi dang /
translated: Similarly, they do not stand in volitional factors, consciousness, name and form, the six sense fields, contact, feeling, craving, appropriation, existence, birth, old age and death,

original: mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa rnams la mi gnas pa de ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la rnal 'byor du byed pa yin no //
analyzed: mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa rnams la mi gnas pa de ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la rnal 'byor du byed pa yin no //
translated: not dwelling on sorrow, lamentation, pain, sadness, and disturbance, in that way they practice the perfection of wisdom.

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la mi gnas /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la mi gnas /
translated: They do not dwell on the perfection of giving,

original: de bzhin du tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mi gnas pa de ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la rnal 'byor du byed pa yin no //🔽nang stong pa nyid la mi gnas pa de ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la rnal 'byor du byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mi gnas pa de ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la rnal 'byor du byed pa yin no // nang stong pa nyid la mi gnas pa de ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la rnal 'byor du byed pa yin no //
translated: and similarly, they do not dwell on the perfection of morality, patience, perseverance, concentration, or wisdom. In that way they practice the perfection of wisdom.🔽They do not dwell on inner emptiness,

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar la mi gnas pa de ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la rnal 'byor du byed pa yin no //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar la mi gnas pa de ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la rnal 'byor du byed pa yin no //
translated: up to they do not dwell on the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature. In that way they practice the perfection of wisdom.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams la mi gnas pa de ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la rnal 'byor du byed pa yin no //🔽de bzhin du yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / lam rnams la mi gnas pa de ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la rnal 'byor du byed pa yin no //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams la mi gnas pa de ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la rnal 'byor du byed pa yin no // de bzhin du yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / lam rnams la mi gnas pa de ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la rnal 'byor du byed pa yin no //
translated: In the same way, they do not stand in the applications of mindfulness, and so on up to: they do not stand in the eightfold noble path.

original: de bzhin du tshad med pa bzhi rnams dang / bsam gtan bzhi rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi rnams dang / mngon par shes pa lnga rnams dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa rnams dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du tshad med pa bzhi rnams dang / bsam gtan bzhi rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi rnams dang / mngon par shes pa lnga rnams dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa rnams dang /
translated: In the same way, they do not stand in the four formless concentrations, the four formless attainments, the five superknowledges, the emptiness, the signless, and the wishless.

original: rnam par thar pa brgyad rnams dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu rnams dang gzungs kyi sgo rnams la mi gnas pa de ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la rnal 'byor du byed pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa brgyad rnams dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu rnams dang gzungs kyi sgo rnams la mi gnas pa de ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la rnal 'byor du byed pa yin no //
translated: “He does not stand in the eight deliverances, the nine serial absorptions, or the dhāraṇī gateways. In that way he practices the perfection of wisdom.

original: de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu rnams dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi rnams dang / so so @178b yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la mi gnas pa de ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la rnal 'byor du byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu rnams dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi rnams dang / so so @178b yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la mi gnas pa de ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la rnal 'byor du byed pa yin no //
translated: “He does not stand in the ten tathāgata powers, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, or the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha. In that way he practices the perfection of wisdom.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de ni 'di ltar gang la gnas par bya ba dang / gang la rnal 'byor du bya ba de lta bu'i gzugs mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar gang la gnas par bya ba dang / gang la rnal 'byor du bya ba de lta bu'i gzugs mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is because he does not apprehend form in such a way that he could stand in it or practice in it.”

original: gang la gnas par bya ba dang / gang la rnal 'byor du bya ba de lta bu'i tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang la gnas par bya ba dang / gang la rnal 'byor du bya ba de lta bu'i tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because feelings, perceptions, formative predispositions, and consciousness, in which one might abide or in which one might apply oneself, are non-apprehensible.

original: gang la gnas par bya ba dang / gang la rnal 'byor du bya ba de lta bu'i khams dang / skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i yan lag dang / pha rol tu phyin pa dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun rnams dang /
analyzed: gang la gnas par bya ba dang / gang la rnal 'byor du bya ba de lta bu'i khams dang / skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i yan lag dang / pha rol tu phyin pa dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun rnams dang /
translated: because the elements, the sense-fields, the limbs of the dependent origination, the perfections, the thirty-seven aspects of enlightenment,

original: stong pa nyid thams cad dang / ting nge 'dzin thams cad dang / gzungs kyi sgo thams cad dang / tshad med pa rnams dang / bsam gtan rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad rnams dang /
analyzed: stong pa nyid thams cad dang / ting nge 'dzin thams cad dang / gzungs kyi sgo thams cad dang / tshad med pa rnams dang / bsam gtan rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad rnams dang /
translated: all the emptinesses, all the meditative stabilities, all the dhāraṇī gateways, the immeasurables, the concentrations, the formless absorptions, the eight aspects of liberation,

original: mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu rnams dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa rnams dang / mngon par shes pa rnams dang / stobs bcu rnams dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi rnams dang /
analyzed: mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu rnams dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa rnams dang / mngon par shes pa rnams dang / stobs bcu rnams dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi rnams dang /
translated: because the nine serial absorptions, emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness, the clairvoyances, the ten powers, the four fearlessnesses,🔽the four detailed and thorough knowledges, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha are non-apprehensible.

original: so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad rnams mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa la mi gnas pa'i sbyor ba yin no //
analyzed: so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad rnams mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa la mi gnas pa'i sbyor ba yin no //
translated: This is the application to not stand in form, etc.
